text: I came in here for the first time with a friend on Memorial Day sine we were both off work and thought'd we'd grab brunch.  The restaurant was crowded, inside and out.  I usually dont like staying at places to eat when it is terribly busy but decided to just stay and try it out.    The server approached our table and asked for our drink order.  I asked about how they make their bellini's (type of alcohol used and if it was served frozen or on the rocks, pretty basic questions) and she did not know.  She told us she was "kind of  new" and didnt really know too much about the details of ingredients and such (?).  After more awkward conversations not getting anywhere, the bartender approached our table and informed me how the bellini's were made.  It is irritating when the server is not familiar with pretty basic preparation of menu items and is unable to answer the customer intelligently.  We ordered an app, the cilantro/jalapeno/edamame hummus with cucumber, pita bread, and carrots for dipping.  The hummus was completely bland and tasteless (surprisingly, because we thought it would be spicy) and the veggies for dipping were warm and soggy.  Dont order this app.  For our entrees, we ordered a steak salad and the Double D Turkey Burger.  Both were large portions.  Ended up taking half the steak salad home.  The Turkey Burger had a nice flavor.  It was still pink in the middle, but not bad enough to where I wouldve wanted to send it back and wait longer, so I just dealt with it.  The service was slow, but we didnt seem to mind too much because we were chatting away.  After our entrees, the waitress simply dropped the bill off at our table without even asking if we wanted a dessert.  After waiting for her to come back (again) we told her we wanted to order a dessert.  She returns a short while after and tells us the "kitchen is closed and we couldnt order dessert."  WOW, REALLY?  NO?  It's dessert people.  It is not like the cooks are sitting back there "cooking" the dessert.  It was clear the waitress just didnt want to try anymore.  We asked to speak to someone else, (manager probably) who, promptly approached our table and asked us what dessert we wanted and of course we could order a dessert.  Again, it is just very irritating to be told "no" at a restaurant when you are the paying customer, just because the waitress was too lazy to inquire further about it or simply just to try a little harder to please the customer.  I understand it was a holiday and the restaurant was closing early and everyone working probably wanted to get out of there.  But trust me, there are plenty of other restaurants out there to chose from.  You will likely get treated better, have a wait staff that is actually familiar with menu items, and wont tell you "no."
I recently attended a holiday party at the Daily Dose. Great experience, great food and a very professional staff. I highly recommend using the Daily Dose for your next party!
Food was cold and the service was inattentive. Mimosa was nice and my kids liked their waffles.

This place would get 5 stars from me but about every third time we go the food is bland. It appears to depend on who is in the kitchen. Most times the food is great, the service is always great! Raymond is awesome.

I go to the Daily Dose for breakfast every other month or so. The food and coffee are consistently very good, service friendly and excellent, never too crowded or noisy like a Matt's or Vovomeena, and not over-rated and hyped like the very mediocre Snooze nearby. When old reliables like Over Easy have lost their way and are failing, the Daily Dose remains a reliable go-to for an excellent breakfast

I was so pleased with the food and service here!!! I would recommend daily dose to anyone. The waffle was AMAZING!!! I was so upset with myself for getting full!!! I wanted to finish the rest so bad!   The vanilla latte was little too foamy but was still good!

Chorizo omelet was great and my wife liked the turkey sausage omelet  Service was fantastic   The one bad thing was the pancakes  Oooooo the pancakes  Rubbery on the outside soft in the middle  Not a nice golden brown almost like it was rushed  And that's all my kid will eat     Nothing further
Place clean, staff attentive and courteous,  food always perfect, keep coming back...
Second time here.  Food was amazing.  Our server adam was great.   Cinnamon pancakes are freaking awesome.  Looking forward to next visit.

Love Daily Dose! We always have great service and delicious food. I had the Mixed Berry Protein Pancakes this morning and they were phenomenal. The server was on top of drinks throughout the meal and everyone enjoyed all of their food. The others at my table had the biscuits and gravy, peanut butter and jelly waffle, strawberry waffle, and Black Forest ham omelette all were delicious. I'm not a huge fan of the DD hash (butternut squash, mushrooms and onions), but everything else is always delicious.

I've come here A LOT. Today I came for lunch and decided to place an order for take out. Usually we go and have NO ISSUES. This time we were practically ignored while waiting for our take out order, which you order from the bar. We ordered two salads which shouldn't have take 35 minutes to get, but it did. The duck dynasty looking dude at the bar who was getting COMPLETELY WASTED and smelled of alcohol when he walked past us was getting better service. PS it was 12:30 when we were there!!! About 5 people who ordered AFTER us were served their food before ours was ready. When we stood there looking at the bartender with the "where the fuck is our order" glare she told us it was being "boxed up now". 10 minutes later we got our food. I have been there about 6+  times, a few of those were with groups, and I can say I'll never go back. Thanks a lot.
Love the corn cakes with chorizo and jalape√±o, Yum! This place has a delicious and creative menu.
I had to give it one star to get in here.   It received an 8 on risk factors on the current inspection list.  I have never seen one that bad.   Yikes.....

Excellent service, great all-day breakfast menu, and a great happy hour. I'm constantly drawn back here for an amazing omelette and a fun crowd. It's an amazing location and it has become my go-to spot for lunch with a friend.

As a local place i really want this place to be better than it is. Its decent but cant even say its good. There food is consistently decent never good/great. Service is so inconsistent.  Some servers are great some are simply awful.   I just watched our waitress stop by the table directly next to us 4 times b4 she came back to check how our food was. By the time she came back to check how the food was i was already finished and my plate was taken by the bus boy. Well if you came by earlier you would have know the side of turkey sausage patties was terrible (btw the menu says links). The links use to be some of the best i had, the turkey patties are not even edible.    I may stop in for lunch or dinner when a desperate last minute decision comes up but other than that ive given up on this place. They have gone down hill and fallen off the cliff.
Had breakfast there on a Saturday morning.   There was a wait, but they had me seated in under 10 minutes.  Both the service and food was good.  The bloody marie was damn good.   I will be back.

We went at 830 am on Sunday and there was no wait. When we tried to go at 1030 last weekend there was a 25min wait. Early bird does get the worm! I enjoyed the eggs Benedict with Black Forest ham. The breakfast was a large and filling portion. Service was prompt and will definitely come back.

Daily Dose serves a bigggg cup of coffee at breakfast, and I love that!  Another thing that really impresses me is that the booths have very high backs, so if you are having a business meeting or a private conversation with a friend, your voices and faces are blocked from most other customers.  The food is good and the menu is varied...healthy choices and the regulars, too.  The service isn't great, but it's very manageable.  The location is great for people who are meeting someone because it is right off the 51 freeway at Camelback.  Give this one a try.  You'll like it.
Great breakfast!   They did a perfect job splitting our meal.   Loved our waitress - ask for Monica if you come here.
Great food and happy hour prices! I had the nachos and frozen margaritas. So delicious. On Fridays, they have extended happy hour so check it out!

Really like the patio which I've visited several times. Great menu selections and the food is good. Generally speaking, so is the service. However, this morning one of several dogs on the patio, this one sitting next to me, became easily agitated and began to bark aggressively at other dogs. Though the other dogs would respond in kind, their owners intervened to calm them while the owner of the instigator dog did not. This same dog was raising on hind legs to reach another customer's high bar table. When the dog placed his snout on the edge of my table, I had to ask the owner to keep him away. My complaint with Daily Dose is they did nothing to address the situation for the benefit of myself and my fellow diners. Please next time do something. I would like to come back.
First visit and last visit tonight. Ordered a burger and plate came out with a large hair on it. Ruined my appetite.

I am very lucky to live in the same neighborhood as this place! Without a doubt the food and service are fantastic. After reading some of the reviews I have to say that I'm sure some of the occasional staff may have off days but I highly doubt they have these issues on a regular basis or it would have happened to me. Management staff is also top notch. So are those servers from Minnesota!  Overall my favorite food items to order are the chicken nachos and any of the tacos. I also LOVE their breakfast. If you are unsure about trying out this place then definitely come for breakfast because they really do it right. The turkey sausage omelette is also my favorite but the simple bacon, eggs, and potatoes are also done extremely well for a simple breakfast dish. I am also impressed by the large selection for breakfast. Many places just have a few items and it's nice to mix it up sometimes. Other items that are great include the burgers, salmon, and ribs. One of these days I'm going to get back into the kitchen and figure out how to make that white cilantro jalapeno sauce they put on the nachos. Totally addicting! Now if I could just get one of those TV channels to be changed to Foodnetwork or HGTV I'd probably never leave.   My only request for this location is a big bike rack! We love to ride our cruisers and now is the time of year for folks to be out riding so I don't want to have to turn back if I can't lock up my cruiser.

Went to have lunch here today - I give this place 5 stars!  We were greeted and seated right away.  The place was really cute, contemporary and nice vibe, played a good variety of music.  They have seating in the bar area and a dining area with tables and booths.  I ordered the fried polenta (was OK), roasted veggie grilled cheese w/ sweet potato fries (IT WAS THE BOMB) and I had a pomegranate green tea (THE BEST TEA).  My friend had the panko crust chicken fingers - I had one and it was delish!  For all that, my bill was $15, which is not bad!  Next time we go, we're going to try something else - the menu is great, and they serve breakfast too!  I recommend this place to anyone.  Great food and great service! :)

Place has always treated my friends and family well.  It has great food, solid bloody Mary's and while service may be spotty here and there, everyone is friendly and like I said - the food is great!  I come here all the time.

Poor poor service! This is the one place were service was cold and food cold as well. Even the manager was cold. I will never come back and this was my first time. I told them and they ask questions like what type of bread, well tell me what types you have and it was a "sigh fest" I should have left but I'll spend my money else where!   I'm taking my food to go and no offer of a bag to put the box and 3 condiments in. If there was a zero star I would give that rating,

Came here on Saturday morning around 11am. The place was pretty busy, but no wait to sit outside on the patio. There was a bit of a wait to sit inside, but I enjoy sitting outside when the temperatures haven't heated up yet. Very friendly service, the server was very prompt, thorough, kept our water replenished and was attentive but not to the point where it was annoying. Really nice. The food isn't life changing but was tasty, good portions and hit the spot. I ordered the chorizo omelet, with potatoes and butternut squash hash. Good. My bf got the turkey omelet and enjoyed it as well.  The parking lot has a bit of construction right now, so it was a little tricky to find parking. This will probably be resolved in the coming months. Another thing I liked about this place was the diverse crowd. (I enjoy people watching.) There is a gym next door so there's a combination of people from the neighborhood, families, young people, and a few post-workout folks. All in all, I would come back :)

We have been going to the Scottsdale location of this resturant for years and the food there is usually great and so is the service. We were in phoenix recently and we decided to try this location and oh man did we regret it. The food was still good but I can say we had the worst service we have ever had here.   We brought my nephew with us and as we were waing for our waitress go get our drink order he was sitting on my lap almost asleep. When the waitress walked up the first thing she said was "oh look there is a baby at Myyyy table " totally deadpan with a mean look in her eyes. What?! We just kind of laughed it off because we thought she may have been trying be funny. He was asleep the rest do the meal. She had an intense scowl on her face the entire time we interacted with her.  The waitress also never refilled our drinks or asked if we needed anything after getting our order. We had to ask other servers walking by even for our bill.  And finally, as were eating we could hear her by the bathrooms (we were in one of the booths) LOUDLY complaining that she just "wanted to go home" and that "we were taking to long" and that she "just hoped that we would leave soon". We only had our food for like 5 minutes at the time! We were really surprised and upset. I could understand it maybe we were being rude or something but we weren't and the place only had two other tables seated so........ I don't even know. We even still left her a tip which looking back I regret now too.   Overall, the food was good but the sevices was just so mean that we would never go back probably not even to the Scottsdale location. We were really uncomfortable and hated the entire experience. No food Is worth it.

Had lunch here the other day and ordered the blue crab cake sandwich and a side of some sort of hash, the waitress suggested. The sandwich was awful. Soggy crab cake that had zero flavor. The "hash" was a bowl of mush. The kids Mac n cheese that my little man got was better than my whole meal. This place may be good for breakfast but this lunch was a mess of mush. Yuck!

My girl loves the raspberry/fruity tea drink. I had a great burger the first visit, the fish tacos tasted better than they looked. 2nd visit... chicken nachos tasted fine, but every other chip I pulled off was stale... I mean a chewy tortilla chip is not good. My girl's fish and chips were fine, her dipping sauce was great. We'll go back for happy hour, for the lower prices.

I took my 3 year old for brunch after an appt I had. It was a nice place and loved how it had brunch items. My daughter had the kids meal starter and it was plenty! I had a full Cobb salad and that was plenty. I only gave it 4 stars only because I was not satisfied with the bloody mary. It wasn't dressed like how I would think it be...it wasn't as tasteful as I had hoped. I had to add salt and pepper to mine. To me it tasted like tomato juice with a chipotle like vodka or something.  Other than that, the food was quite delicious, service was superb and I would visit again....Maybe I'll try the Mimosa next time!

So good. First time here. Wait was 10 minutes.  I had the eggs benedict, DD style, with turkey sausage, and the DD hash. My husband had the chili verde omelette.  Everything is made in house and fresh. Loved the house made raspberry jam. Try it! You will love the place.

Had my doubts as another douche hangout, but it was a great mix of people from the neighborhood on a Saturday AM.Small patio, but looks really nice. We got seated quickly inside. and placed our drink orders with our young new waitress.    We asked what she recommended and she gave us a pretty good lowdown. The Mrs had the breakfast nachos and I had the french toast. The nachos came out huge and full of taste. The french toast looked small when it cam out, but once you dig in, the richness fills ya. So good! She shared and had a great breakfast.  Good coffee, good service and good food. We will be back

I have been to the Daily Dose 4 times in the last couple of months.  The bottom line is that the food and the service are two completely different things.  On the positive side, the food is very good.  However, I don't think I have seen one employee that actually looked happy to be there...not one.  I feel like I am putting people out anytime I am asking them to do anything for me.  And follow up to find out if your meal is good...a rarity.

Three strikes you're out! Been to Daily Dose three times with the hope of having a better experience.  The service is poor, the wait time is long and the food is nothing to rave about.  On two occasions the food was cold.  Many other better options in Central Phoenix.

Let me start off by saying the breakfast nachos were delicious!!! Just perfect. The chips fresh and crispy enough, the mix of flavors... great! Coffee is also full of flavor and the mimosas were generous poured. Customer service was on point with our server Kegan. By the way, we tried going to Snooze before coming here. Place was packed and we were starving. Daily Dose is right around the corner, and let me tell ya, I thought this was way better than Snooze. Customer service, food and coffee... hands down better.

Don't wait in line at Snooze, go to Daily Dose.  It was not crowded at 10:30 am, super clean, wonderful protein pancakes which were enough for a meal later, great service from Vicki!  and breakfast served until 4!

The food wasn't that great and kind of flavorless and the service wasn't that great either. I got the bacon omelet which was okay but nothing special and a side of corn beef hash that needed a lot of hot sauce for a flavor.
Amazing! Fantastic! Best food and drink selections for a GREAT price!

Tried to order here from Postmates; after a half hour of waiting (after the order said it was accepted and ready) the Postmates driver called and said they don't deal with or take orders from Postmates... Makes no sense to me.  If someone wanted to walk into my restaurant and spend $80 on food I'd let them.  Guess they lost a sale (and all future sales) since I order and use Postmates for meals all the time.

I only gave this restaurant one star for the following reasons: The front hostess was so blaze as if she could not care less whether we were there or not.  No welcome, no Good Morning. She walked past tables for two and seated us next to the kitchen.  We were tired so we kept the table.  Servers walking toward the kitchen yelled orders 10 feet  before they got to the kitchen.  When was asked for water rather than coffee, our server looked crest fallen.  It took forever to get our order, 20 minutes.  We ordered basic breakfasts, nothing special.  A table was seated after we placed our order.  She got her breakfast within minutes.  We still waited.  We asked several times where our order was.  The same apology came and we were told it was on the way.  While we were waiting, we saw a server drop a napkin roll of utensils on the floor under a table.  He picked it up and put it right on the table.  Who ever uses it will be wiping their mouth with a napkin that rolled under a table where people put their dirty feet. The food was just OK, nothing special. Granted we were a little creeped out by the  dirty napkin put on the table.  The check came in the usual black holder which was covered in greasy fingerprints.
Genuine friendly service and greet menu! :) :) Nice casual environment for a laid back lunch or casual bite.
Happy hour is great! Food is good. Beer selection lovely. Skip the berry pancake for breakfast way too much carbs; could not finish it.

Absolutely loved this place. Came here twice on my 4 day trip in town. The hamburgers were fantastic topped with bacon and cheese. Sweet potato fries were very good but too salty.   My breakfast experience was even better. I ordered the protein pancakes with hash browns and a side of bacon. The bacon was cooked perfect, not too dry or soft. Very meaty and not much fat. The pancakes were likely the best I've ever eaten. Stuffed with fruit and flax seeds, they were delicious. Needless to say, I ate my entire meal. The server commented that it's very rare to eat the entire meal so it's just proof that it was good.

The food is bomb here. Our hostess is super nice. Think her name is Lisa. I'm really bad with names. Blue lipstick and very attentive. Not from Arizona and got lucky we found this place. Really recommend it. Protein Bowl is very satisfying. Thank you Lisa for the recommendation.

What a great spot! I was just looking for a quick spot for a working lunch, and this certainly fit the bill.  Food was unique, healthy and hearty.  Service was quick and friendly.  Great beer selection.  Can't wait to come back.

I'm surprised the reviews at a glance are mediocre. I love coming here for breakfast, specifically for their eggs benedict. I have really quick and simple service when I sit at the bar. The servings are huge so I always share.  I haven't gotten to come on a day to enjoy their morning drink menu that's on my to-do list.  I have come for dinner-- most of what I had was pretty forgettable (their dinner menu is kinda blah), but the soft pretzel style burger bun was delicious. i recall the happy hour being fairly good, too.  Give it a shot for breakfast!

I am now a regular at daily dose both for breakfast & lunch. Perfect for all types of occasions & appetites. All of the food is made in house, they have a nice variety on the healthy side, truly savory options for the not so healthy side ;) I highly recommend the banana bread French toast, it's incredible & not too sweet at all! I love the unique DD hash as a side dish; butternut squash, onion, potato and light seasoning = heavenly. Also recommend the Eggs Benedict & NEW BBQ sandwich melt, even their side salads are a generous portion & very fresh! I've met friends for brunch (mimosas & bloody Mary's are great) & even brought my dog on the side patio for a quick bite. You have to check this place out!

These guys are doing a pretty good job, the coffee was great (and served in a giant cup). I had a waffle some turkey sausage and 3 eggs. Turkey sausage was very forgettable, the waffle was good, and the eggs were not cooked correctly for over medium. It is in kind of a weird spot a little off the beaten path, but they keep it rocking for Sunday lunch/brunch. I have been to the one in old town and had the breakfast nachos and was excited to try this location. I plan on heading back and taking another shot at something a little more daring on the menu next time. I will say this, their DD left me wishing I had the cottage cheese.

My boyfriend and I have visited this location the past two Saturdays in a row. We had the same server both times (she even remembered us). The food is delicious and the bloody mary's are the main reason why we go! They serve them in a pint glass and not the smaller glasses that some other brunch places in the area offer. The portions are pretty large and Ive had to take leftovers home both times. Favorites are the flannel hash and the biscuits and gravy. We will definitely be back again!
We were very happy with our meal here!! Our server, Amanda, went out of her way to make sure our experience was a great one. We both had omelettes and loved them! We will be back.

This is not your gourmet meal but is a standard default for unpretentious large portions of goodness.  The wait is never long.  The waitresses regularly checks on you but not so often that you feel constantly interrupted.  This review is solely on breakfast/brunch.  There are so many dishes to choose from.  I would recommend the prime rib omelet, the crabby omelet, the egg white choices, hangover breakfast sandwich and the biscuits and gravy.  I'm a huge fan of corned beef hash but I wouldn't recommend it here.  Maybe it just doesn't suit my savory taste buds but I don't like my meat sweet.  It might be the southwestern style but I'm not a fan.
Really yummy food! I will defintiely go back.
Went here for lunch and we enjoyed it. The food was good. I liked the outdoor seating and I am looking forward to trying it for brunch!

We are visiting from out of state, were looking for something local and not the usual, so we stopped in. What a pleasant food and social experience, entire staff were friendly, and service was great. We would love to become regulars.

I had very low expectations just going in: this looks revolting from the outside. I was quite surprised by the indoors, however. Very swanky and clean! Modern! Nice lighting.   The good: The dining room. Already went over that. Honorable mention: The service. Our server was quick, attentive and kind.   The bad: The food. I had the green chili chicken enchiladas. Horrifically over seasoned! Every bite was like trying to swallow a forkful of pepper. The enchiladas sat in my stomach like a pair of squeamish bricks that are too afraid to touch each other. Very unsettling.   On way out, I had the chance to get a good look at the kitchen area. Not the cleanest kitchen in the world, people. And one of the prep cooks was chewing gum. Unacceptable.    I should have followed my gut instinct and stayed away from this oh-too-familiar bar food cuisine. That's what I get for trying something I was leery about to begin with! I ate over six hours ago and my stomach is still hating me.   The two stars are for the cleanliness (of the dining room ONLY) and for the servers.
Lots of food for your buck, tasted great and the staff was very friendly. We came out of there stuffed full. We were impressed.

So amazing! #Paleo Substitute DD Hash for the potatoes the hash is made with squash mushrooms and onions and it is so good you won't believe it! Fresh Squeezed OJ? Yes Please! Of course the have toast and pancakes for you grain eaters and I  am sure they are as good as the many gluten free options!

BLAND food and poor service.  I've tried four different dishes, an been disappointed every time.  To make things worse, the service was insulting (and I believe our server was a manager) I wont be returning, but Im rooting from them; hopefully they can turn it around.

Ambiance: much better than I expected since you really can't tell what it looks like from outside except for the patio. Nice booths and overhead lighting. We were at a table and I was surprised by how busy it was in here.  Food: I had the Rueben sandwich with apple sauerkraut. I asked the server before ordering it if it was grilled; she said it was. It was definitely not grilled, but rather between two pieces of marble rye toast. The overall flavor was nice: corned beef was well seasoned, the sauerkraut was sweet and tangy, and the sauce was nice, but I wanted more. The cheese, if there was any (I couldn't tell), was paltry. Those that know this sandwich know that it is like a grilled cheese with corned beef, sauerkraut, and thousand island dressing. But this one at least had a nice twist with some green chiles. The fries were pretty good, too.  Service: our server was very sweet and efficient.   I may come back and give it another shot because it is close by.  That will determine whether   I keep this rating or change it. I usually either really like or hate a place and this place was neither good or bad.

Great everything they need longer hours of operation! I've tried to go there for the last two weeks and they close at 3 PM! This is not helpful for people who drive forever far and then have to wait an hour for a table! NEEDS TO STAY OPEN LONGER TO SERVICE EVERYONE! SOO STAY IN LINE OR DONT BOTHER DRIVING FAR TO GO THERE! You will most likely not be sat down and leave! This place WAS AMAZING UNTIL THEIR SECRET GOT OUT NOW THEY SEEM TO NOT CARE IF EVERYONE GETS SERVICED! Most awful experience ever' when I called to confirm both locations had the same hrs the woman on the phone said "yes, sorry!" then proceeded to hang up the phone. I'm terribly depressed on the snide treatment; that's managed to happen to my favorite go to brunch spot! Sucks to say this post is sad but true! I wish everyone a better experience than I've had as of recent this has been two wkends in a row

I had been to the daily dose in Scottsdale, so I thought I would give this place a try for lunch while I was passing through Phoenix. Despite what other reviewers have had to say, I actually thought the service here was great. It was Labor Day, so I think it was a little busier than usual, but we were seated within 15 minutes. We ordered The eggs Benedict, one turkey sausage and the other with the crabcake  (which was interesting but good). We also tried the banana bread French toast.... Which was delicious. They use fresh banana bread, and it tasted almost like a dessert! Definitely will be back again

Nice little spot near frys.  I've tried it twice for breakfast. Nothing that special but then again it's nice and safe for a meeting or work breakfast.  Last time I went for a meeting and our server was fine but she did not seem like a happy person.  Usually business will strive if they have employees who enjoy being around people.  Also one of my colleagues asked for a diet coke mid meal... And then she asked 2 other random people after a while and then those people sent our server back over to ask if she can get us anything.  Why did they not just tell her to bring a damn diet coke????  So my friend is like A DIET COKE please.  If the servers could work as a team and help each other out for the good of the customer it would benefit the customer and business for sure.  I felt bad for our server because she has no help!

this is really close to where we live, so it's a nice place to drop in for a snack and/or drink. their shrimp cocktail (mexican style) was very yummy. they've got a decent happy hour...they have something against corn tortillas (there are reportedly none in the building. ever.)  my biggest problem with this place is that it feels so canned and corporate. given the option, i'd probably pick somewhere else.  they do have a steak salad that i found pretty impressive...but unless you just worship onions or are planning on being alone for an extended period of time after eating, ask them to reduce/minimize/delete them from the dish. i forgot to do that once and lived to regret it.

I am usually a Daily Dose lover and have been to multiple DD locations. This past Saturday I went to the Highland location for brunch with some friends, as it is near my home. I had the Egg White Wrap, and unfortunately got a terrible case of food poisoning from it later that day. When I called on Sunday just to let the restaurant know, I was told by the person I spoke with on the phone that they hadn't heard that from anyone else yet (mind you it was early Sunday morning), and that he appreciated my "feedback". I am pretty sure calling a restaurant to let them know I received food poisoning from eating at their establishment does not fall into the feedback category usually associated with service, etc. Needless to say I was very disappointed in their utter disregard to my phone call and their dis concern for their patron's health. I will not be back to DD again and will definitely be telling all my friends and family to avoid the Highland location!

I love Daily Dose! This tends to be a great go-to spot for lunch meetings and really any business lunches. The food comes out pretty quickly so if you're in a time crunch you don't have to worry here.  I have never had to wait for seating, and I love how they have a nice patio to also eat on when the weather is nice.   Service is hit or miss...it is usually either really great, or just the opposite (although I think I have had much more great service than bad service).  I love the gourmet coffee drinks on the menu and they even carry coconut oil to add a splash of flavor and nutrition to your coffee.   I usually order the portobello mushroom with egg whites and fruit on the side...it sounds boring but they do a great job spicing it up and it is more then enough food without the guilt of going overboard on brunch!  *Side note - they do carry gluten free bread here which is a major plus in my book! And it doesn't fall apart when you pick it up! ;)  I recommend Daily Dose for breakfast, brunch, lunch, business meetings, etc!
I food was excellent. The service, wasnt so good. Ask to ask several times for jelly, lemons, napkins & warm syrup.

I want so much to love the Daily Dose.  It is in the perfect location for me to make it my go-to spot for weekend brunches.  But I just can't get 100% behind it.  Every time I'm there, I search the extensive menu over and over again for something that jumps out at me.  But every time, I find myself at a loss and just ordering an omelette or french toast or something equally banal.  I'll keep searching, but with every trip my hope dwindles.

Service and a big selection of food is fabulous! I've been there only 3 times meeting friends who live in the far west and far east, and each time I saw many people from business offices and drop-ins come to lunch there on Highland and 51. I haven't tried the one in Scottsdale where I live. A must try!

My boss and I went there for lunch as we were getting our job trucks washed at a nearby car wash.  we looked up on the internet nearby bar and grills and this place showed up.  A bit of a disappointment as far as a bar and grill, but as far as the food goes, very good.    When we first walked in we did not see a hostess or a sign that stated please wait to be seated, so we took it upon ourselves to sit where ever.  We were then met by someone that asked if we were being helped and we said no.  She said we normally have a hostess, but she was no where to be found.  We both thought that the person that greeted us had a bit of an attitude?    Our waitress, she had a great attitude and made our stay very entertaining.

I'm not sure how this place is still in business. This place has so much potential, a nice location and great design. But the service is horrible and the food reminds me of Applebee's.  I was sat on the patio in the dark (lights didn't come on for another 15 minutes) and waited for the server to come by and greet me. Then I waited some more. Finally after 10 min I flagged down a busser to look for him. I could understand if the restaurant was packed but there were only about 8 tables in the whole restaurant and a full wait staff. The server had NO knowledge of the wine list or drink menu. And it took me another 5 minutes to get my coctail and a glass of water.  He knew even less about the menu. Put int he wrong order for the table, but the food actually come out at a decent ticket time even if it was only 1/2 of what the table ordered. The food was just ok, presentaition was pretty decent but there was NO FLAVOR. The server didn't even come by to check on us, so I had to flag another food runner to get the rest of what we had ordered. (I don't know why I even bothered.)  I could stand mediocre food for great service. Likewise, I could stand shoddy service for great food. But this place is hopeless. I thought after being open for a few months they might have worked out a lot of their kinks. Obviously they have a very long way to go.

Moves to Chandler AZ  few weeks ago,  still  not really know my  ways around  and  where to go. a friend take me to Daily dose this morning  ,   and  the food was Fantastic  ,  i  had a Omelet ,  it  was great  , the service was fantastic ,   i will definitely  keep go there as well.   i also hear that they have another place in Scottsdale  AZ  ,  so i will  go there next time to try.  Great Food !!!

Great quality  breakfast at a great cost. My husband and I normaly go to the Scottsdale location but decided to check it out since we were in the neighborhood. I had a chocholate covered strawberry pancake, daily dose hash and turkey sausage (all ala cart). Yummy! I even enjoyed the water with a slice of cucumber. Refreshing. This location is much larger than Scottsdale.

I like this place.  We sat on the patio and had lunch. I have been to the other location several times for breakfast and dinner.  I had the steak salad and it was good.  I would have preferred just a bit more dressing but I would rather it be sparse then to much. One companion had the chicken nachos. They were huge and tasty.  The other companion had a burger.  He seemed to like it.  We had no issues with service or food so they must of worked the kinks out based on earlier reviews.
The service is terrific and I truly felt at home! Can't wait to go back!

My first visit here I had the hangover sandwich... WOW! I was hooked immediately. The Daily Dose Burger is always prepared to my liking, the Prime Steak Salad is a huge salad and is a delight to my tastebuds! I would stay away from the gravy, it's not what you'd expect from breakfast gravy. The staff is quick, friendly, and on top of their game. I will visit here again and again!

Came here for brunch around 1030 on a Saturday, and the wait was only about 15 minutes! Pretty short compared to other places in the area!   I had the breakfast nachos which were delicious. Has egg and chorizo, pico de gallo salsa, cheese, and I added a side of guacamole. The chorizo and salsa is what made the dish.  They've got a large selection of breakfast and lunch items, so I definitely need to come back to try more.   The customer service here is awesome. My mom has to adhere to a gluten free diet, and they're extremely accommodating and knowledgeable about what people with diet restrictions should/shouldn't eat.   On top of all that, our waitress-Stephanie-went above and beyond for us. She recommended a dish for my mom, and when it came out, the pancakes were too salty. So Stephanie took the food back to the kitchen without question, and recooked her order. But before she brought out the new food, the chef made a new batch of batter and had her try it to make sure it tasted right before now bringing it the order to my mom. Now if that's not customer service at its finest, idk what is.   Highly impressed, glad we came here for brunch.

I love coming here! It's nice to find a dog friendly patio in the mid-town area. I'm sad that the hours changed, since the few times I've been here were for dinner. Food is tasty, drink specials are good, & have always enjoyed the service!
You can tell they just opened, but the employees and management were all working hard trying to get their system down.  Just like the Scottsdale location, the food was awesome!

Tip, arrive early because they are always busy especially on weekends! You will likely wait but it is worth it. They have a large healthy portion of the menu but after a late night out that was not in our cards this morning! Refreshing cucumber water and full bar.  Two favorites "crabby" omelette, fluffy omelette with crab cakes and spinach and Breakfast Nachos OMG it is so good in a bad way, a Mount Vesuvius size pile of chips with two types of cheese sauce, scrambled eggs, pico de gallo, jalape√±os and chorizo, I am not a fan of chorizo so I opted out of it they were really nice offering to substitute another meat instead to which I declined but I appreciate the offer.  To top this sinful splurge off what do they bring you to dip your nachos in?? Gravy ! I feel the need to visit a cardiologist but I have no regrets in this occasional splurge FYI it is so big it will probably be 2 or 3 meals for you.  Staff is attentive and friendly, don't let the crowds standing outside intimidate you just allow for some time.

My favorite breakfast places are First Watch and Daily Dose.  I love them equally the same.  When I want a boozy brunch I go to Daily Dose.  When I want a nice, hearty, extra healthy brunch or breakfast I opt for First Watch.  Any who .... I've been to Daily Dose more times than I can count.  Doesn't matter if I'm dining with 1 other person or 4, there's always a small wait.  No longer than 10 - 15 minutes.  If you're alone, you can definitely find a seat at the bar. The omelets looks delicious.  I've honestly never tried them only because they're made with 3 eggs and 3 egg omelets are way too much for me.  I've tried the Steak & Potato Bowl and the Turkey Sausage & Polenta Bowl.  Those two are my favorites.  Along with the biscuits and gravy, banana bread French toast and the Southwest Wrap.  I've ordered those things over and over again ... never get tired.    I branched out recently and ordered Steak & Eggs, fried eggs with herb potatoes and a biscuit.  I ordered my steak medium.  I received a very well steak.  I sent it back.  The server was very apologetic.  Because my friend and I had plenty of Mimosas and plenty of other food to eat I didn't mind waiting for the steak.  The manager (I believe) was kind enough to bring the steak out to me himself once it was ready. It was juicy, cooked perfectly and sooooo tasty.  I enjoyed it and I'm adding it to my list of favorite Daily Dose dishes

This is one of my favorite breakfast restaurants! They have a huge selection of food and drinks (alcoholic and non). They have a wonderful patio that is great for the cooler months! I love the variety of items available and the service is always great.

A nice addition to the camelback corridor dining scene. Went with a group of 5 and we all had a hard time choosing between so many good options. I had the signature burger with Harissa aioli on a pretzel bun--moist, juicy, and full of flavor. And I snagged a bite of the hangover cure breakfast sandwich, which was also good. The space was upscale contemporary if a bit too corporate Starbucks-ish for my tastes, but what it lacked in character it made up for with good food and friendly service. Definitely recommended as a solid neighborhood haunt.
Mediocre at best.   Not horrible but would not come back.    Waffles were way too dense.   Like eating bricks.    Service was just OK.

First time we went on a Tuesday we had great service. Just left on Sunday and service was horrible. The two bartenders were gabbing and socializing so much the customers were ignored. Food is always good but won't be running back as there are so many good breakfast places around.
Bloody Mary is a little on the watery side, but good and spicy!  I come here for the breakfast nachos! Can't go wrong with those!

Get beyond the pancakes, eggs and bacon. Have the chorizo + jalape√±o corn cakes! Add a medium well egg to the top and a bit of syrup. You won't regret it! Sweet. Savory. Spicy. Then sweet again. Order a glass of milk :) What a delicious breakfast adventure this dish is!!

Went to Daily Dose this afternoon for lunch, although we all ended up getting breakfast.  Definitely understand why it is SO much busier in the earlier hours of the day. The breakfast is AMAZING! I could have eaten everyone's meals. I go the Hangover Sandwich-perfect.  The service was also great. They offer a 50% discount to military, but only when in uniform. My husband is military and since it is Memorial day they still took half off the ENTIRE bill for 4 people.  Top notch place.

What an awful experience. Ya know those restaurants that are just trying too hard to be trendy and end up throwing all sorts of weird shit on your plate because it looks pretty but tastes like hay? This is one of those places.   Too much to complain about but myself and 3 others came in, spent 45 minutes waiting for lunch and we all didn't like what we received.
Came here for breakfast, fast service, friendly staff, very good prices! Their OJ is delicious!

Awesome food.  Tara was a great server!  AC needs to be turned lower. Our group of 5 was very hot. Waiter at next table sweating pretty much the entire time we were there. Come here often and first time we had this issue. We definitely will return and not let this deter us.

*Daily Dose Midtown*  Me and a friend had finished our meals and had stayed around to continue in conversation.  We were sitting outside and the weather is nice today so we stayed a while longer. After refilling our water 2 times our waiter (Jesse) comes back as ask us if we could leave (is in he was kicking us out) because it was picking up and the restaurant had started to form a line.... Without fuss I complied and stood up and as I was leaving a nearby couple had asked me if he (the waiter) just asked us to leave... I told them yes.   I do not know if that was proper protocol but I must say ... I feel extremely embarrassed, appalled and disrespected. I enjoy the Daily Dose for its food and atmosphere and have come here on multiple occasions and truly loved everything about it. I'm able to separate this experience from those but this none the less is not becoming of a establishment I enjoyed.
My favorite place to get breakfast. The staff is awesome, food is great and it won't kill the pockets! now I need to try something off the Lunch and Dinner Menu!

Good food, great mimosas and you must try the breakfast nachos! We have been here on a few occasions, every item we have orderd has been delicious! We visit during the week with co-workers and never have to wait for a table and service is great.

Ok.. over all review is a 3.. this visit is a 1 for the fact that it is colder in here than the 36 degrees outside!  Ask if the heat was on and they said it was on.  OK, it's not though. It's like eating In a refridgerator.  Oh please let my food stay warm enough to eat while they carry it to the table.

My husband and I were craving breakfast. We had heard good things about Snooze and wanted to try there, but when we went there we were told that the wait is over an hour. I understand that breakfast places are super popular, but who actually wants to wait over an hour to eat?  So we decided to try our luck elsewhere. This brought us to the Daily Dose. We were promptly seated and our server was over in a timely manner. We order the quesadilla, portabella mushroom (breakfast menu), and the turkey omelet. The food was delicious! We had so much left over, we were able to have breakfast the next day.   It seems like the Daily Dose has a lot of different drink specials.. we didn't try them since we were craving coffees, but I would like to go back to check them out.   Overall I highly recommend Daily Dose.. I'm not sure I will try to go back to Snooze since I know that there is a great breakfast place down the street that doesn't make you wait over an hour.

First time here and didn't disappoint. Don't let the people waiting to be seated turn you away; it's worth the wait! Excellent service and food. My eggs Benedict with smoked salmon was delightful. The hollandaise sauce just right, not to heavy but creamy and tasty. I sat at the bar and enjoyed a spicy Clamato Bloody Mary. Will definitely be back.

Having Easter breakfast with the family. Great service, food, and atmosphere. Our waitress, Susan, was such a doll and very accommodating. We will make a spot for this place on our breakfast rotation.
Good location. Great breakfast menu and drink menu. Is starting to become my "come to" spot for a bloody and breakfast.
Just stopped in for a casual lunch and service was great.  Solid menu and the southwest wrap was awesome. Really quick to get our food!
I bring my kids in a lot, the bacon is on point and so are the Chelada's. The service on ordering a drink is always slow unless you are sitting at the bar. It is slow drink service at all locations.
Great menu! Has any breakfast food you could want (omelets, biscuits and gravy, fun pancakes, bowls, sandwiches, etc.)! Enjoyed sitting on the outside covered patio and service was great!
Nice atmosphere, good food and Great service from Samantha S.  Note to cook: please add more lemon to the hollandaise sauce on the eggs benedict.  Diane N.

The Little details are what count the most. I brought my little dog so we had to sit on the patio, immediately they brought a bowl of water and a milk bone, so it started off very well. It's January so it was  a bit chilly they had heaters and clear curtains that they put down for us.   We ordered the bacon bloody, which had too many little bacon bits for my liking, and the cucumber vodka bloody and that was just alright. We waited for awhile for breakfast to come (everyone else that got sat after us had gotten their food) and then Stephanie, our server, apologized immensely and said she forgot to order our food. We understand but were surprised when we got our bill and they had still charged us for everything. We had 2 omelets and a half of a french toast, I thought for sure they'd take the French toast off for the mishap.
Service was very fast and food was awesome. Not packed like the Scottsdale location, take advantage early.
Just dropped in and decided to try this place out for breakfast. It was a good decision for this Friday morning. The naked pan cakes hit the spot!

Went for lunch. The service was friendly, but my drink went empty for a little too long. The burger looked and tasted like a frozen bland patty. I have made better ones at home. Shoot some fast food places make better tasting ones. $13 for bland burger and fries and drink? Although the fries were pretty good. I'll pass overall thank you!

Breakfast nachos are ridiculous (in a good way)! If you like lots of meat and cheese, you should get them. I've had a few different pancake/waffle options, and they are all so yummy! Service has been consistently good.

Not once has there been a time were I have been disappointed by their food or service. Their menu is nice and far from the usual dull breakfast norms. They are constantly checking back to see how you are doing and for refills and the size of the plates are pretty big.

Great food, decent prices! Excellent for brunch but get here early! We like to come and sit at the bar. This time I got the crabby omelet, biscuits and gravy, and a waffle. They were all excellent. I highly recommend the double mimosa too ;)

OMG!!! Our new favorite restaurant!! Just tried it for the first time last Wednesday morning. The Sweet Roll Pancakes on their menu had my interest.  They greeted us with huge smiles and sat us is a very comfortable booth. Two servers tended to us... Kegan and Sass. Wow!!! They are the best.  I had to try the Sweet Roll Pancake..OMG AGAIN!!! I cannot even describe the "yummyness"!! It is a melt-in-your-mouth experience. Good God!! Please try it. It is soooooo good.  And everything was good. You will soon have a new favorite restaurant too. We returned back on Saturday with some new friends to show them what a great place Daily Dose is! Equally as excellent. We are taking friends next Sunday too - they will love it.  10 STARS!  "The Breakfast Yelper's Crew"
The Happy Hour menu has changed.  Our favorite foods are gone!  Happy hour ends at 7:30 and I swear it used to last until 8.  We were so sad to see the changes.
Great breakfast. A regular for visiting when in town. Good flavors and service. Nice staff

You can't really go wrong with any Daily Dose location. For a Saturday around brunch time, we got seated within 5 minutes indoors. Server was very attentive even though it was busy in her section. She was very friendly and on top of refills and checking in on us. Food is always pretty good no matter what you get here.
We have been loyal customers to Daily Dose simply because we've never had bad service or food! We sat at the bar and had excellent customer service!

The midtown location continues to disappoint with their lack of customer service! We sat for 15 minutes waiting for a server and when she arrived she was not at all apologetic. In fact she asked if we needed more time when we hadn't even gotten water!! Then the food took forever...how long does it take to cook 2 eggs over easy!!  Last time I'm coming here!!

Heard and read about this place a lot before I finally got the chance to pop in. Came last week during my lunch break and my only complaint was not being able to indulge in happy hour and try any of the cocktails (don't think the boss would approve). So I settled for the Caprese Grilled Cheese with a side of Sweet Potato Fries and the waitress so kindly made me an iced chai latte though it was listed as a hot drink only.  Everything was TASTY and the menu is huge. There are so many options to choose from - this is definitely one of those places you have to visit multiple times to not only try breakfast, lunch, AND dinner, but all the different dishes they offer for EACH of those courses.   As Arnold would say, I'll be bach.*     *Austrian pronunciation for "back."

Finally decided to give this place a chance since the reviews have gone up to a 4* average. Don't be fooled! Nothing the other diners around us looked very good so we decided to try other items. I had the huevos ranchers which was more like two eggs on top of a bean soup and had a folded flour tortilla on the side. I put all the jalape√±os on, the salsa they provided, and many shots of cholula and it was still flavorless. My partner had a turkey sausage and egg white scramble with toast and a bowl of fruit. His response was "we chose the worst place for breakfast in the city". On a positive note, the service was good and refills on the drinks kept coming!

Found this place on yelp while planning my trip..Talk about bang for your buck. With the recent trend of fancy brunch spots this place keeps it real. Good food and plenty of it at a reasonable price. I had the crabby omelette (2crab cakes on top of a fluffy omelette, with roasted potatoes, a bowl of fresh fruit,  & sourdough toast for $12. Mimosas were perfect champagne with a splash of fresh orange juice. There's no way I could get this much food where I'm from under $20. I couldn't eat it all.

The portion sizes are huge. The tempeh & grains omelet was one of the best ones I've had. It was deliciously amazing! I had some sort of hash, I think the server called it a butternut squash hash, I could be wrong but whatever it was it complimented my meal well. I was so full off of those two items I couldn't enjoy my potatoes that came with the meal. Great bang for your buck! The next time I'm in Arizona, I will definitely be back for more.
This place was amazing. The staff was super on their game and the wait wasn't bad at all. The food was fabulous. Love it.
Super good I had the flannel hash and didn't leave a piece on the place I would recommend and bring the kids also

I go here for just one reason.  The banana bread french toast.   Only this time it was different.  In the past, the banana bread was banana bread.   You know, like a real thick, soft piece of proper cake, but banana.  This time the banana bread was bread.  You know, like the stuff you make sandwiches out of.  Kinda tough and chewy and dry.   This totally changes the dish.  I don't know if it's a one off or something that they modified with their recipe.  I'll try it once more.  If it's still dry and bland, I won't be coming back.   (after all, that's why I come here!)
Do not eat the fruit.  First time I found a hair.  Second time I found a beatle.  There won't be a third time.

This is my second time visiting this place and the breakfast is phenomenal! Both times I've gotten the Turkey Sausage Omelette with the DD Hash and a side pancake. The portions are large and the pancakes are huge so no need to order more than one. I've also tried the mimosas once and I wasn't too much of a fan of them but the coffee is great!!! They also offer complimentary coffee while you wait to be seated that's pretty good stuff.   This place is also great for large groups. There is a nice patio area with misters and a nice size dinning area. I haven't been here for lunch or dinner but there is a nice size bar with a couple of 32in TVs. So not the place to come to watch a game but that's what sports bars are for anyway. This place is know for there breakfast and there is a good reason for that just look at my pic.

Daily rocks!       Best Banana Nut French Toast ever. If God made anything better he kept it for himself.     Came during lunch and wanted Crab Cakes, but they weren't on the "lunch" menu, BUT the amazing bartender (Drea) hooked me up and they were amazing.       The patio is amazing this time of year. Check them out you won't be disappointed :)

Took a friend there for lunch. Terrible experience. We received the wrong order. No real apology. Tried to fix things. Didn't really do that. No offer to assist with a discount or added item. Nothing. Server seemed more interested in helping people having alcohol rather than us. Server was grabbing lemon wedges from the container. Pare hands. Touching and putting them back. Hands not clean. Do not get a lemon with you're tea. I will not be back.

This is hands down my favorite place for breakfast. They have everything from super healthy options to s'mores French toast. The outdoor patio is small but covered and really nice. I have always had great service and great food. I plan to get here soon for lunch to see if it can match breakfast! Definitely recommend if you have family or friends in town.

Food is good, location is great if you live in the area. Service has been hit or miss. One time no wait by the door, made eye contact with 2 servers and my husband and I waited at the door/hostess stand for 15-20 mins to be seated and said screw it--- left and ate elsewhere. This was on a weekday evening so no chance of special event, and past happy hour. Only disappointing experience. But try the breakfast nachos if you like hearty/savory breakfast options.
My favorite place for breakfast. Although I enjoy everything I have tried. If you like Breakfast Club at Cityscape you will love Daily Dose!!

I'm from out of state and make it a point to come here at least once every time we're in the area. Food here is normally pretty good. I've been here a handful of times. Can't complain about that part. There's 2 things I wish I would've known before for this particular visit. 1, their specialty coffee drinks really aren't that good so save your money on that. 2, their new menu (or maybe it's their breakfast menu layout) is misleading in my opinion. I went to particularly order gluten free food and ordered a breakfast burger. To my dismay, when the burger arrived it didn't have a gluten free bun, to which I ordered. It arrived on 2 pieces of gluten free bread. I asked the manager that happened who just happened to walk by and he informed me that they no longer have gluten free buns just the gluten bread. Well, then remove it from the menu please. That's misleading and causes frustration for me who didn't know that upon ordering. The other issue I have within their menu is on the breakfast burger I ordered it says "pick a side" so I tried to pick a side from their side menu. The waitress (not her fault) informs me that the waffle I wanted was $5 extra. BUT it's in the sides menu and it's a side. Shouldn't it be an option without an extra cost?  The menu doesn't say or restrict otherwise (from what I recall) it literally just says pick a side. So naturally, I look for a sides menu. And think I have free choice because it doesn't say otherwise.  I'm sure I'll be back again. But I'll be more cautious to ask those things.

I'll start with the good: the happy hour drinks and the patio are pretty freaking awesome.   The bad: Ordered the turkey burger because the waitress highly recommended it. I love turkey burgers, so I was SUPER excited. She promised that it was like omg SO good. It wasn't. It was horrible.  I am convinced that they were trying to get rid of soon to be expiring turkey or that she gets some kind of turkey burger bonus.   The ugly: we ordered nachos for the table.  They brought the nachos out and we started eating. They came back a few minutes later and said that our plate was actually a special order for another table.  THEY TOOK OUR PARTIALLY EATEN PLATE OF NACOS AND GAVE THEM TO THE RIGHT TABLE.  I wish I was kidding but thIs actually happened. You could tell that our plate had been picked at as well.    That has to be the craziest thing that's ever happened to me at a restaurant.  None of us could believe that happened.  So gross.

I would say the Daily Dose has a better selection and better tasting gluten free options on their menu than Snooze, or another other AM eatery.  My favorite breakfast from here is any of the delicious, sweet dessert pancakes sided with some of their stunningly addictive squash hash, and fatty bacon. My mom loves the peach pancakes. I also prefer their corn beef hash to any other restaurant, although I've always found corn beef hashes to be salty if they are not homemade.  An excellent breakfast place for those looking to taste food that is gluten free but impossible to tell!

Several friends and I met here for Sunday brunch and it was an overall pleasant experience. Cozy atmosphere, very friendly staff, and the crispy polenta with poached egg and poblano that I ordered was very good. Because we were a larger group that came late morning on a Sunday, there was a rather lengthy wait but that is not unexpected for a popular brunch joint.

Brought my Sister and her friend from Illinois here for a late breakfast/lunch. The staff was on point and the food is all recieved from local farms as much as possible. Ruben was out of this world.. OMG so good..

It looks like a lot of the higher reviews are for breakfast. So maybe I'm doing it wrong, but I will never know because I wont be back.  I've been here twice for dinner and was not impressed. The first time I tried the mahi sandwich with a side salad. The flavor was good, nice ingredients like avocado and bacon, but the fish was overcooked. I tried to power through because I enjoyed the flavor, but just couldn't get past the rubbery, chewy fish. I ended up just pulling the fish off of the sandwich and finished it as a bacon/veggie sandwich sans fish.  I decided to give this place a second chance, maybe the last time was a one-off situation. I ordered the grilled chicken cobb sandwich with fries, and experienced deja vu. I took a bite into the sandwich and the whole piece of chicken slid off with it. Again, the flavor was there, the pretzel bun was good. I tried another bite and couldn't get past the rubbery chicken. I again, pulled the piece of chicken off of the sandwich and ended up eating a bacon/veggie sandwich.  If I wanted to eat rubber for dinner, I would just stay at home and gnaw on my dog's Kong. It's too bad because if the fish and chicken were cooked properly, this place would actually be good.

We waited for about 15 minutes given the small restaurant was packed for a Sunday brunch. (Then you know it's good) No issues since we wanted to sit outside. Host staff was super friendly walking in considering how busy it was.   Can't say enough how good our food and bloody Mary's were. Perfectly spicy and not too overwhelming. I ordered the turkey sausage and polenta bowl and my friend ordered the steak and potatoes were both had huge portions. Our drinks and food took a little longer than expected but we were busy talking so it passed time.   We will definitely be back!
Great food, service, and drinks! Just an FYI, not open for dinner. I've been there many, many times and I will be back again.

The staff is amazing and the food is even better! Forget the chain breakfast spots, this is the best place to get your breakfast fix. This is coming from a self proclaimed breakfast food hater, but after trying the Daily Dose menu options I've found a new love for the most important meal of the day.  This place is awesome!

I am a new fan of Daily Dose MidTown! My family and I ate there for breakfast, and I went for the Sweet instead of Savory, which is very rare for me, but it turned out to be yummy! I got the PB&J Belgian Waffle. Such a creative dish and so HUGE! The portions here are monstrous, so come here with a big appetite. Others at my table got the prime rib benedict, the breakfast nachos and the berry multigrain pancakes, and all were huge portions. We left full & satisfied. Only withheld a star because there was a 20-minute wait in the hot sun with no chairs or benches to sit on. I feel like this would be an easy accommodation to make guests more comfortable.

This place is so great! It was past noon on a Saturday and my friend and I were looking for somewhere to have breakfast for lunch. Most of our go-tos stop serving breakfast around 1-2pm and we didn't really want to be, "those customers." So we Yelped some options.   Daily Dose was one of the first to come up in the area and wow, served breakfast until 4pm on weekends! So we went.   I was so surprised when we walked in. There are indoor and outdoor seating sections, really friendly staff, and wow (again) so many options on the menu! We started by each ordering a bloody mary and then proceeded to take forever to choose from the many options. Again, I am soooo glad they serve breakfast later, as there never felt as if there was a rush for us to order. I finally decided on a Belgian waffle which turned out amazing. Upon receiving our check, prices were great too. Really awesome place.   I will definitely be back here! So many, "wows!"

First time here with was my wife and granddaughter I had the blue crab cake patty melt which was absolutely incredible my wife had  fish tacos also excellent our  granddaughter had the child's grilled cheese sandwich  it was a full sized sandwich and actually made like you would for an adult definitely a place I would return to

Review for brunch only...  I woke up on a Sunday morning craving food. I woke up my roommate and used bribery and peer pressure to get him to agree to come out  for brunch. I told him pancakes fix hangovers. I even offered to buy his meal. He said he'd go, and all I had to buy was his first Bloody Mary! DEAL! It happened to be Easter Sunday. I called another restaurant and confirmed they were open, and called Daily Dose - was told they'd be open until 2. Since we can walk to Daily Dose, we opted to check it out. I also called and invited one of my favorite coworkers, who decided to meet us there.  The roomie and I started with Bloody Marys, waters and a coffee for me. The server then came back and asked the roommate for his ID. I asked if she wanted mine, too. She did not. BAD FORM! Unless I looked old enough to be his mother (I do not!), we should have both been carded. Servers should know this...it's the kind of thing that is reflected in the tip!  All the food was fresh and tasty - portions were ginormous. Crab cake Benedict is one of my new favorite things. Roomie had a burger that he was happy with, and a pancake on the side (gotta love hangover decisions!) I don't remember what the coworker had - I believe it was one of the omelets. We were all quite happy with the flavors, quality and quantity of our selections.  The server managed to make a boo-boo on the check. After my roommate and I had our cards run and my coworker had received her change, she came back to the table to inform me that she forgot to put my coffee on the bill - and what should she do? I was totally thrown off by this and answered (probably with more snark than needed in my tone) "wow! looks like you just bought my coffee! thank you!." Seriously? AFTER the bill is paid, you're coming back to tell me you forgot the single cheapest item ordered - the one that cost the restaurant less than a dime, and you think *I* should do something about that?   I am sure I'll give DD another shot. The location and menu is too convenient and appealing to pass up entirely. But no matter how great the crab cake Bene was, I left with a bad taste in my mouth and felt regret I hadn't pushed for the other restaurant instead.

I have been to Daily Dose twice in the past week and it has been wonderful both times!  Lindsey was our server at our first visit and she was awesome!  The food was hot and delicious and everything was wonderful! I have worked in the food and beverage business for 30+ years and I love when a restaurant matches up to expectations.  I have recently moved to Arizona and am looking for a position that fits.  I felt that the DD and I would be a good match up.  So, I talked with Lindsey about it and she informed me that there were some possible upcoming positions at the DD.  She gave me an application and told me to try and come in on Saturday and she would give the manager (Allen)  a heads up.  I could not make it on Saturday, but I called Allen and explained who I was.  He asked me to come in on either Sunday or Monday after 2pm.  Yesterday (Monday), I did just that.   I walked in, introduced myself, handed Allen my application and resume and also told him I would be having lunch.  He told me that he had a interview coming in but that he would come over and speak with me when he was done.   That NEVER happened.  I didn't see him interviewing anyone, but he could have been doing that in a different part of the restaurant.  I waited for nearly an hour for him to come over and he never did.  I kept standing up to see where he was and he was standing at the bar each time.  How DISAPPOINTING!   If he didn't think that I would be a fit for DD, all he had to do was say so.  In all my years of management, I have never blown anybody off like that.  What an awful representation for the DD.  Little does he know, that I would have been such an asset to his team.  I am positive, energetic and love making connections with others.  I love the Food and Beverage Business and am passionate about customer service, team work and making the best of each day.   I'm sorry that Allen treats people in this way.  I hope he decides to take the time to get to know what people have to offer and finds the right people for his establishment.
Love this place. Good food, good service, good pricing.  Highly recommended. A bottle of bubbly and a carafe if your favorite juice for under $20. Cheers!!!

A friend introduced me to Daily Dose on Highland a few months ago raving about the breakfast menu and we've returned for lunch and happy hour several times.  I've been back alone several times for lunch.  The kobe beef burgers have been consistently great (I like them best medium rare) and the pretzel buns only enhance the flavor! The sesame chicken skewer appetizers were tasty - just short of being a little dry when I ordered them last week. Servers have always been friendly. On 2 occasions no hostess was present and when she did appear offered no apology for making us wait. I'm sure that will be corrected so I'll be back and will refer friends.  Daily Dose is a great addition to this area.

The food is good, but I was disappointed in the quality of service.   I sat at the bar on a Sunday and it was not busy.   I had to ask three times for coffee creamer.   No water or coffee refill.  No one asked how the food was.  I saw an employee holding a disgusting rag that he was going to clean a table with.   The bartenders basically ignored the customers sitting at the bar.   I used to be a frequent customer at the Scottsdale location, which always had awesome service.    I'd chalk this experience up to a bad crew and poor leadership from the management.   With the amount of competition in breakfast/brunch spots in the area, i don't think I'd give this spot another chance.

I find that I tend to look at breakfast joints with a touch of extra scrutiny in part because the definition of what constitutes breakfast is often set in people's minds.  And sure, breakfast can be different things to different people whether its an omelet, pancakes, toast, cereal, or whatever.  But when you get down to it, there are three types of breakfast spots.  Those that are resolutely old school (i.e. Mike & Ronda's The Place, Mel's Diner, etc.), those that try to innovate (Zookz, Pomegranate Cafe, etc), and those somewhere in between.  Daily Dose seems to fit the somewhere in between category.  Having driven by Daily Dose's central Phoenix location for years, it was time to finally pay a visit at opening on Saturday.  Located just off the 51 freeway on the north side of Highland and 22nd Street, Daily Dose's Phoenix location has a laid back neighborhood feel from the moment you walk in.  The restaurant isn't particularly large, but can pretty comfortably pack in upwards of 100 patrons at a time.  Matt and JenLyn Long are the proprietors of Daily Dose which opened its flagship restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale almost a decade ago and the menu at their central Phoenix hub is identical to the one in Scottsdale.  With every breakfast spot I goto I'm looking for items that really stand out on the menu versus other breakfast spots.  Oftentimes I can pick them out myself, but some restaurants will steer you themselves by highlighting their own specialty items on the menu.  And it just so happens that Daily Dose circled one menu item in particular that they seem to take great pride in.  I've had chicken and waffles at plenty of establishments before including the iconic original Lo-Lo's in Downtown.  Daily Dose' Chicken & Waffles does their own spin on the dish.  The chicken is encrusted with bacon and fried, the waffle is a corn waffle and the toppings include two eggs your way (scrambled for me), corn salsa and harissa aioli.  And of course syrup to pour on top if you want (which I did).  I decided to get a side of DD's house made hash as well as a bowl of fruit.  And of course some fresh squeezed orange juice to wash it all down.  Total cost including tip came to about $25.  It should be said that the portion size of this dish will satisfy pretty much anyone's appetite as the waffle and chicken were both huge, and I certainly didn't leave hungry.  That said, this dish was far from perfect in my opinion.  I'm fine with a waffle that has a nice soft chewy inside, but I like a nice crispy exterior to go with it.  Unfortunately the exterior of this waffle was just as soft, thus giving the waffle more of a texture of pre-toasted bread than a waffle.  No complaints about the chicken or the aioli as both were delicious.  If you love corn, you'll probably love this dish in its entirety.  For me, it might've been a bit of corn overload between the corn waffle and the corn on top.  Even with the syrup, I didn't get much of the sweet savory punch I'd hoped for with this dish.  The other disappointment for me was the hash, which was basically equal parts onions, mushrooms, and potatoes.  If that's your thing, go for it.  Me?  I'm not a mushroom guy and would much prefer just a scant amount of onions and some corn beef or other filler as a substitute for the mushrooms.  The fruit bowl was solid with a variety of different fresh fruits and the orange juice was plenty satisfying.  Overall an okay, but somewhat disappointing first impression.  I'm quite confident in Daily Dose's ability to deliver a good meal on the more traditional fare they offer including the omelets, benedicts, and their assortment of healthy breakfast items.  But in terms of the more innovative stuff, I'll need to see some improvement over the meal I had this go around.  All of which is not to say you should stay away from Daily Dose, but rather just approach the non-traditional fare with caution.  And if you want my two cents, skip the hash.  Hopefully the next time I'm here for breakfast (or lunch) my meal will be up to par with the aesthetics of this neighborhood staple.

Enjoyed breakfast this morning at daily dose.  I had steak and eggs, with potatoes and toast.  It came with a horseradish sauce and au jus.  My partner had chorizo omlette and potatoes, with dd hash.  Everything tasted wonderful.  The service was fantastic.  The cups of coffee were huge, but welcoming as was the French pressed English breakfast tea.  We will be back soon, with friends.

We stopped by for brunch this morning and the Daily Dose did not disappoint. The staff is super friendly and menu offers something for everyone from breakfast to lunch items. My son had the breakfast burger which was a 1/3 lb hamburger patty with a fried egg and bacon on a big soft bun and it came with a huge side of fresh fruit. I had the pigs in a bagel sandwich which was eggs and bacon on a plain bagel and it  came with fruit and herbed potatoes. Everything was delicious and the service was quick considering how busy they were.  Brunch for two came to about $23.00 before the tip.

I always get the Turkey Sausage Whiteout and my honey gets the Breakfast Nachos and we LOVE them! the place is bright and spacious and the ambience is really nice. They are always PACKED on the weekends so there is always a wait to sit in anywhere other than the bar area. We have, however, sat in the bar area and the service was even better and faster. Food always hot and delicious and they are willing to modify anything on the menu. Sometimes too busy and you have to waive down someone to help get you something.

Nice place, good service. I had the chicken enchiladas, which were OK but kinda boring, hence the 3 stars instead of more. Haven't these folks ever heard of herbs and spices? However, I was with friends and they said their entrees were very good.
Yummy perfect breakfast!! Love the French toast!! Bacon cooked to perfection..... best OJ also!!!

I can't believe how different my dish was.  I usually go to the Daily Dose in Old Town and 9 times out of 10 get the prime stack sandwich.  The bun was the same, but not much else.  The meat was skimpy and unevenly spread on the sandwich and they were cheap with the slaw.  It also seemed like they heated the meat up on the grill because it was super dry and there were parts of it that tasted burnt.  It was utterly disappointing and if that was the first time I'd gotten that entree item I probably would never know how great it could be.  Service was also pretty bad for not being very busy.  I don't think they refilled any of our drinks and I had a watery remnants of coke for half the meal.  The Old Town branch is better with the service as well.

I keep coming back here are keep getting excellent service and terrifically tasty food so what can I say besides IM A FAN! The chorizo Mac n cheese made me want to lick the bowl after we finished an appetizer portion of it. I kind of did, but in a classy way- with my finger! ;) it's that good! The turkey burger was the best I have had in a long time. The pretzel bun is incredible! I finally had breakfast there and it was to die for! Breakfast nachos and a peanut and jelly waffle with syrup and bananas? Yes please! It was a bit much, but we had to do it!
