There were so many other things on the breakfast menu that I wanted it was hard to decide. I wouldn't do the nachos again by myself, but would definitely split them with others. I want to try some of the mouthwatering omlette's next time. Too many good choices here, they have me hooked.
I have eaten at the daily dose a few times and the food, service, atmosphere have always been stellar! Dog friendly patio too!!! Love this place! My fave dish on the menu: breakfast nachos!!!
This is the second time I've been to this restaurant and both times the service was extremely slow. I will not be coming back here again.

Food alright, Drinks not bad, SERVICE IS HORRIBLE- manager was there the whole time and was just as bad as the incompetent bar tender who couldn't handle 4 tables in a dead restaurant. I was appalled and will not return

I've been going to lunch here for quite a while and I think I've only had one bad thing on the menu.  (Stay away from the chicken fingers, super bland)   Hey have an amazing chorizo Mac and cheese, mahi taco, great burgers, prime rib dip, salads and just about anything else has never let me down.  Friendly staff and a nice location.
Had lunch here, got a BLT with fries, pretty tasty, good service, great location, clean facilities, will be back. five stars.
Good food but slooooowwww service that doesn't check up on you to see if you need anything .

Let me start by saying I think I prefer the downtown Scottsdale location.  I think the service was a little bit better there.  Food was just as good though.  I love the heart healthy option of egg white omelette with turkey sausage.  I think its called whiteout something...  Comes with a HUGE bowl of fresh fruit!  Hubby likes the steak/prime rib sandwich that comes on a pretzel bun.  He didn't enjoy it as much this last time but it's still a good choice on the menu.  They have a ginger champagne drink... its delicious.  tastes like Gingerale...  tried to make it at home... just didn't taste the same...  DD what's ur secret???  I think they do have a good happy hour but I haven't been to it yet...  Speaking with my other foodie friends... they all enjoy this place as well...  a lot of choices on the menu... Oh and last time there... someone ordered a burger... it looked fantastic... gonna have to try one of those sometime.

I ordered the chorizo mac and cheese, turned out to be pretty good. Not a huge fan of the chorizo, but the dish itself was good. Garden salad was pretty decent as well.  I just had a glass of water to drink, which came with a cucumber instead of lemon or lime - I don't think I'd make that call.  Bread pudding for dessert - it was delicious. It had a deep and rich flavor. Definitely recommended.  I'll be back - seems like it would be a good happy hour place as well.

Delicious..  stated with chips & salsa & guacamole.  Guacamole was some of the best I've had.  Also tried both regular fries & sweet potato and both very tasty and both crispy.  They have a Chipotle ranch that we dipped fries in and was just right.  Tacos were good as well as the turkey burger.  And staff was on point.  Very helpful, friendly and attentive.

Whoa! At first, I thought this place was going to be one of those overrated places, where I'd leave feeling..meh...But I'm happy to report that Daily Dose is legit. I guess it helps that I came here in super starvation mode, so the generous portion here earns an automatic 2 stars. I got the Roasted Turkey omelette, which comes with 3 eggs (I got egg whites...ugh, healthy), your choice of toast, potato, and (thats right, "and" not "or") fruits. The potato is where Daily Dose earns its other 2 stars. It was a much appreciated surprise to see deliciously chopped and baked (fried? cooked? i dont know..) potatoes that compliment my omelette so well. Their multigrain toast also tasted a lot better than it sounds. I love it when my stupid decision to go for the "healthy" option does not taste healthy at all!!! For the price, I'm pretty sure I won this round.  They have outside seating, which is awesome in this Phoenix weather. Inside looks nice too. Not to mention, they have a Frys grocery store right next door, and a gas station in the same parking lot..SO I got all my errands done in one spot...pretty darn effective if you ask me.
I've been here a couple times now and while the atmosphere is nice, the food is very average.

Whenever I come to daily dose, I always get a good meal (good). This location has a little patio with some tables that is great in the nicer weather. Portions are an indulgent size.  Last time I was here, I was not too crazy about my chicken wrap with bacon and avocado. My friend and I were so excited about our sweet potato fries until they came out cold!!! That always brings down a star in my book! Our waitress was extremely friendly but kind of slow getting our order and drinks.  Regardless, I love to come here occasionally for lunch and drinks. Just hope they redeem themselves.
I LOVE LOVE LOVE Dailydose. .hands down the best!! Freshest food, best service, nicest staff, cleanest restaurant in town..love the food.  Im telling you, ITS SLAMMIN!!!

Went in for breakfast while getting a car wash, i seated myself by the bar b/c no greeter.  waited for about a good 5 minute before they actually acknowledged me (which is a little sad, it's not like I'm terrible looking or something hahah).  Ordered steak and eggs for breakfast, bloody Mary on the side.  Steak...definitely over cooked with no presentation, just a plain slab of meat with no seasoning and some eggs.  Pretentious and over rated.  Definitely not waste your time there.  terrible service and terribly prepared food.

Five star food but unfortunately the service is so slow i have to take back a star. We shared the breakfast nachos for the table and it so big, we had trouble finishing. They have some great eggs bene (my favorite) and my grandson loves the pancakes. i've been several times now and the food is always good but so far the service-not so much.
Chorizo egg Benedict and the bacon omelet high on the list! The coffee was unusually good as well!

The atmosphere is nice, it's very lively the staff is on top of it. Got the Southwest Flannel Hash it is freaken ahhmaazing! Loved the mixed berry pancakes. Overall, it's a great place. Would definitely come back!

Hi Daily Dose...I love you!  I am a breakfast faaaanatic and this is my favorite spot to go for breakfast. They have an amazing selection of different omelets (bacon, meat & cheese, or the roasted turkey are my favorites), they give you the option of cottage cheese, and their DD hash...don't get me started! My taste buds go wild for this place. The DD hash is a must, it isn't even potatoes, it's SQUASH! Squash?? I know what you're thinking...trust me, it's amazing.   Of course, a breakfast would not be complete without coffee, and their coffee is another perk to this place. It's always fresh and they give you the option of getting syrups (almond is the best).   On some days after my workout I'm feeling extra ris-kay...so I opt for their mixed berry protein pancakes. My first reaction to trying these was to dance in my chair for a good 30 seconds, they are that delicious. Do you tummy a favor and try them! They are huge though, so you can definitely share.

I have been here several times for breakfast and I am always really happy with the breakfast menu.  Although they have the usual heavy breakfast items they also have some healthy low calorie options as well.  The atmosphere is nice and the service is always fast and friendly.  Today, I really wanted something refreshing while my boyfriend wanted a burger.  I admit that I was a bit skeptical about the lunch/dinner menu but I was pleasantly surprised.  I ordered the strawberry mint salad.  It was amazing!  It was perfect!  It was exactly what I wanted.  My boyfriend was also really happy with his burger.  We also sat outside and the weather was perfect also.  Everything was great!

Perfect little brunch place! We came in around 1 and decided to sit outside because of the amazing weather that day. Our group of 3 came hungry so we decided to order 2 appetizers and an entree for each of us.   We ordered the nachos and hummus with pita and holy moly the portions are huge! The hummus was pretty average, it was a little too grainy for my liking, but the nachos were great! I bet you're thinking "how good can nachos be?" and that's usually my thinking as well but along with the traditional nacho toppings it came with a tomatillo salsa and a white cheese sauce that makes it unique.   For my entree I ordered the breakfast burger with fruit on the side. A side of fruit with a burger may seem insane but when you have so many heavy ingredients such as runny egg yolk, pork sausage, bacon and cheese sauce, something light and refreshing is definitely welcome. Overall the burger was good, with great bacon and nicely cooked runny egg! The only minor issue was that the pork patty itself was very heavily seasoned with paprika and cumin which made it taste like mexican chorizo. It's not necessarily a bad thing but it overpowered the rest of the burger.   Overall a great place for breakfast or lunch and would love to come back again!
Best breakfast in town. So many options and they are all amazing. Try the dd hash for a unique take on breakfast potatoes. Any of the eggs benedict are mouthwatering.  Puppy friendly on their patio.

Good brunch spot with a surprisingly tasty drink menu - especially if you like carbonated alcoholic bevs for brunch :-)  Ordered the flannel hash overeasy and my friend ordered the gluten-free turkey burger - both good.  The meat in the hash could've had more flavor though. Service was prompt, everyone was friendly, and a buzzing, social atmosphere. We will definitely be back.
My new favorite breakfast place.  Breakfast Nachos are CRACK!!

I love getting breakfast here. Love the chorizo wrap, the cinnamon roll pancakes, the power bowls, and the DD style Benedict. You can't go wrong, is what I'm saying... Unless you show up after 9:30 on a weekend, then be prepared to wait.

I have to agree with the overall review rating of 3 1/2 stars. I'm just rounding up to four stars because I see the glass half full.  First of all, my wife love, love, loves the Banana Bread French Toast and would kill me if she knew I was only giving this place 4 stars. The last time I was here for breakfast, I ordered the Naked French Toast with potatoes. I thought 3 tiny pieces of French toast was a pretty weak menu offering. Plus the service during this visit was slow. I had to lay some cash at my table before I got the check since I had to get to the office. I let the bartender know that I had to split and that the cash was on the table. BTW - They serve alcohol in the morning.  Another time I had their burger on a pretzel roll. And it was perfectly cooked and delicious. One of the best burgers I have had in awhile. I also like Daily Dose when I don't feel like fighting the crowds on a Friday night. It's not as busy as some other places so you can kick back and have a cocktail and a mellow meal.
I've eaten here a few times and am disappointed every time. The food is boring and bland!

I'm starting saying this wasn't my first time coming over here; well on Wednesday 27 of September around 8:30 am, I met one of my girlfriend for breakfast, it was my treat, I mentioned it to her that the food was pretty good.  We walked in and immediately the girl at the front look at us in a mean kind of way, she didn't say hello, nothing, just "TWO"? well I didn't like the way she treated us but I didn't want that to spoil our morning. The food was great, my friend liked it so did I, the waiter was attentive.  Towards the end we felt rush cause they kept moving tables, accommodating chairs, mentioning how they were going to sit people around us, (we were just at the corner) WE FELT LIKE THEY WANTED TO GET RID OF US, cause the other party was larger, not cool at all.
Daily Dose is a great place for breakfast or lunch! I've been here several times and have never been disappointed. The service was great also!

The first time that I went to Daily Dose I didn't exactly have a great experience. It took a while to get service and when we did get it, it wasn't great.  I'm happy to say that my next visit was the complete opposite!  We were seated quickly and the servers and I'm assuming this person was a manager was super nice!    I have only tried the appetizers and have been pleased with those. I had the pretzels and the jalapeno chorizo mac n cheese.  The pretzels were pretty good.  It comes with two tasty dips, but the mac n cheese is to die for!  I could eat that dis everyday!  I even took a second order home for my husband to try.  I ended up eating that one too!    Their happy hour prices are pretty good.  I love having so many options!  I will be back!

Meh. We went here for happy hour.   The happy hour prices aren't that great in my opinion. In fact, I found the happy hour prices to be pretty comparable to other bar's normal prices for beers, snacks, etc.  We ordered a few beers.  They were good.  Beer = good.  We ordered chicken skewers and pretzels as snacks.  I thought the pretzels were sub par (though I do always compare pretzels to the mall pretzels... mmm... butter = good) Chicken skewers were a bit on the rubbery side.  Don't think I'll be coming back.

Been here a couple of times and I'm still wowed. The DD Hash is hands down the best thing since sliced bread. Speaking of sliced bread, I had the best darn gluten free hamburger bun tonight. In fact, I got to order like a semi-normal person, getting the bbq black and blue burger with corn meal onion rings (all gluten free). First time since my allergy diagnosis that I've had onion rings and the only gf bun I've not yanked off rather than eat (and boy did I eat). The service is OUTSTANDING - every time we go. The burger was really fantastic (the quality and preparation was aces). I couldn't have been more pleased. The onion rings were great, but remember I've not been able to eat onion rings in over a year, so your experience may vary. Their green iced tea is great. Our servers always go above and beyond and are more than friendly. Although the line can be long for weekend breakfast and brunch, dinner was easier to be seated, and maybe even more delicious.
Erica was great behind the bar this Friday. Quick, attentive and personable. I sat, ate, chatted, and knocked out a cover letter all before lunch... Awesome

I liked that Daily dose accommodated a group of 10 around 1pm for lunch on Saturday in the back. Being from out of town and nearby, the reviews of this place was positive enough for us to check it out.   Here's the downlow: -Service was attentive  -The menu is overwhelming. There's a plethora of choices especially if you're debating breakfast or lunch food.  -The pbj waffle was very filling. Basically peanut butter and jelly on a Belgian waffle. Can't get any complicated than that. It was topped with Alice of bananas too.  -Chicken nachos was a hit at our table. I recommend sharing this because the portion is huge. I wish they had more toppings though. There was more nacho chips.  -Liked that they had a health but section.  Turkey sausage whiteout was average. I didn't think the turkey sausage was very flavorful. It reminded me of elementary crumbled sausage served during lunch. The fruit side was plentiful and I was able to sub out the toast for butternut squash which was good.   I recommend as a breakfast, brunch, lunch spot.

I loved this place! We came here for breakfast and it was delicious. I ordered the roasted poblano and polenta eggs Benedict. It wasn't too spicy and had tons of flavor. The dd hash is amazing. It's butternut squash, mushrooms, and onions and it comes as a side with most of the dishes. My husband ordered the naked French toast and it was really good too. The jalape√±o cornbread pancakes were really good and different but super spicy! I want to come back and try all of their pancakes, because those looked amazing too. The waitress was very nice and the service was good. Love this place!

Consistency pays off! Winner, winner chicken dinner in all categories: 1) courteous hostesses taking ur name down to get seated (complimentary water and coffee always available in the entry way) 2) quick to get seated 3) quick to come by with waters, take drink orders, and food order also! 4) EXCELLENT, FLAVORFUL, GINORMASOURAS REX PLATEFUL O' DELICIOUSNESS!!!!!!!!! 5) low prices for what you get = SKY HIGH VALUE PROP  6) always leave happy and satisfied...I'd smoke a cigarette or three afterwards- IF I were a smoker! Lol

Unlike some of its other patrons, my experience at Daily Dose Midtown was positive. The service was fast and friendly (though the crowd was light) and the food was reasonably good. It's a clean, comfortable, inviting place to meet friends.  Plus, at bar, the HH price is nice.

HUGE fan of the Scottsdale location, came to check this one out since the wait on Sundays in Old Town is pretty long. (Obvi. The food is great.) I'm writing this review on my phone while we continue to wait for the check. Our waitress went missing a while ago... Not that she was around much to begin with. This was after the hostess forgot about us, even though we were in plain sight the whole time. Food is still good, same offerings as the Scottsdale location. I'd suffer the wait at Old Town for better service. Well... That's my review! Still no sign of the waitress or check.....

Worst food and worst service. I'm hooked on the food and service at the Scottsdale location. For some reason everything tastes different and just plain "not good". How do you mess up a Cobb salad or a burger? Will never return unless they get these people on the same page as the other location.

Yum! Get the Chorizo Burrito super yummy- not to big like your usual chorizo burro that makes you feel like you just ate an elephant and then drank 2 bottles of Maalox. Oh and the potatoes that comes with it are just as taste. The bf and I got it to go so next time we go we will try the nice big patio and have a drink or two or....three!
I love Jess best in the biz what an asset she is love her!!!!! Best Gluten free blueberry pancakes anywhere! Service was amazing!!!!

Good food and good location but they don't accept reservations even for large parties of 20 for a special event.  Seems silly and unwise business practice to not at least allow special parties of a certain size to have a reservation.   Get with the times DD!

Awesome place for breakfast if your visiting Phoenix. The bartender was friendly and very knowledgeable about menu. She helped me pick this awesome Green Chile Eggs Benedict that hit the spot. Definitely going back the next time I visit Phoenix.

We had a great time.  We were sat right away,  even though we came around noon on a Sunday so it was pretty busy. We got a bloody Mary and a bloody Maria, both were delicious and unique, I had the sriracha UV in my bloody Mary.  We ordered eggs Benedict and huevos rancheros. We finished everything on our plates.  Our waitress was great too,  she brought us some extra hot sauces and salsa,  and made great reccomendations for beers!  We will definitely be back!

This place has a fantastic happy hour that goes until 9pm!!!! RARE. Love that you don't have to rush from the office! And their Happy Hour has a pretty vast selection for both food and drink. And the pretzel rolls...oh the pretzel rolls. Almost all burgers and sandwiches come on them, thankfully!  Service has always been great, and the food is awesome! Especially breakfast. Lots and lots of options!  We've been to both locations and they are both equally good. But for some reason, other than breakfast this location doesn't ever seem to be as busy; I don't understand why. If you are looking for a new place to try - DO IT! You won't be disappointed.
Interesting menu, great service. Really good alternative to a chain breakfast experience!

I've come here several times for breakfast (they only serve breakfast and lunch) and always had a good experience. The food is good and they offer nice size portions. Bonus points for offering a gluten free pancake option, which is hard to find, and actually really good! I also love the "Grown Up" coffee options. My fav is the Smooth Irish which has coffee, Bailey's and whipped cream vodka. Yum!

One piece of gluten free toast costs $2.25. It says on menu gluten free is extra $.75 but id you order one piece of toast additionally it is $2.25. This was my last visit here and ai've been a regular.
Just ate lunch, great food, fun atmosphere.  I had the turkey burger and combo crispy and sweet potato fries.  I'll definitely come back.
My family we LOVE coming here!! They have amazing scramble options. They're also incredibly gluten free friendly with very unique gluten free pancake options - cinnamon roll is my favorite pancake!
Had a great experience with Daily Dose takeout. I wanted something modified heavily and the guy that took the order (Keenan I believe) was helpful and added suggestions and got the order right.

Alright kids, let's cut straight to the chase here; Daily Dose (Double D) Midtown is without question our (my wife and I's) favorite, guaranteed great experience eatery in the PHX metro area.  My wife and I do a great deal of international traveling for work and fun, which means our exposure to amazing food is prevalent. And as a former 300lb man, I can assure you that my addiction to food is, surely, only marginalized when compared to a toothbrush armed meth-head focused on a filthy grout line. Food is my black-tar, and Double D is my Syringe.   Now, I'm not going to insult any of the other foodies out there by trying to compare Double D to a 5-Star experience, because it's not - neither in presentation or atmosphere, but what it does have is unrivaled consistency, creativity, and made-in-house goodness. The customer service experience is always exceptional, helping to reinforce our love for Dub-D-Delight!  Let's talk food. Avocado covered Bacon Omelette...Dope. Made-in-House berry preserves...Redic. Taste bud-gasmic made-in-house ketchup....WHAT!? Unicorn Tusk infused Buttermilk pancakes (slightest crunch on the outside, soft and magical on the inside)...Sensational. Egg white omelette with made-in-house turkey sausage...mind=blown! Protein pancakes that don't make you call into question your decision to pretend to be healthy...legit! Pretzel bun'd - Angel tear glazed Daily Dose Burger intoxication...radical.   If you like witty repartee with wait staff, managers, and owners who like to laugh and are not afraid to share their honest opinions about life, their bat shit crazy dogs, travel, and just about any mildly offensive topic of choice  - then this is your mutha friggin holy land. Really great people, with really great attitudes.   If you are are a quiet, pretentious recluse who is used to consuming boxed waffles and drinking syrup from the bottle, then stay away - for you will surely be disappointed by the annoying fact that DD is not located in a graveled trailer park lot.   The best thing I can say about Daily Dose, is that we keep coming back for more. We bring friends, family, and colleagues with us as often as possible, and the results are always the same; complete satisfaction.  Keep doing you DD - and we will continue to publicly glutton ourselves in your house of worship. ;)

Pretty decent spot! Today was my third time here. I've had the SW Chorizo wrap twice now and it's excellent. The Gladiator burger is no joke either. I wouldn't recommend their Bloody Mary. Pretty bland

I love the menu here, especially for breakfast!  It is fun and unique and not things you would necessarily make at home.  The staff is always nice when we come.  A great quiet place to have a company meeting or catch up with friends.
Amazing! We stumbled across this place by accident, and what a wonderful accident it was. Wonderful swrvice, reasinable prices and the best breakfast I have had in a while.

This was my first time visiting Daily Dose and I think I got really lucky!  I went for brunch on a Sunday and only had to wait 10-15 minutes for a table on the patio.  The main reason for the 5 stars is because I had one of the best veggie burgers of my life!  If you follow my other reviews, you will see that I'm a big supporter of quality veggie burgers and I try them everywhere I go.  This one was definitely memorable and moves into my top 3 in Phoenix.  The patty is homemade with tasty grains and herbs - not frozen or too hard.  The bun is a fatty delicious pretzel bun which is fantastic but probably not the healthiest option.  It comes with a great yogurt dill sauce that gives it a little Mediterranean flare.  Or it with waffle fries if you're feeling crazy!    If you don't like veggie burgers.... you can't go wrong with any of their pancakes, omelets or breakfast nachos!

The Reuben was terrible. It had no flavor and it lacked corned beef. My buddy had a southwest salad it tasted like air. Basically the food is flavorless. I will never come here again. And the service was slow and it wasn't even busy.
Out shopping with mom and stopped in for late lunch. Love their Desert Fruit tea and the smoked salmon eggs Benedict is delicious!

Love this place! I have high standards when it comes to food. This place does it right!!! They have great coffee, their omelettes are perfectly cooked and have a great amount of the ingredients you ordered in them. Their sides are perfectly done. The quality of their food is great. The fruit they serve is always ripe and delicious. I am not a pancake person, but here I always order a pancake as they are crispy on the outside and fluffy in the inside, made on the griddle. We are regulars and so far I haven't tried one thing I didn't like! Their burgers are amazing too! With a pretzel bun! Their hummus platter! I can go on and on! Great quality food, and you can tell is FRESH! In addition to that, they have #1 customer service. They are on it! And the ambiance is great too! Yes, yes... I truly love this place! Too bad they are not open in the evening anymore!
This place has always been a favorite for happy hour, really sad their closing at 3pm now.

Amazing food and wonderful service. I expected there to be a long wait seeing as it was a Sunday morning, but to my surprise there was none.  The restaurant is very modern and furnished very well. We were seated and had out drink orders taken right away.  I decided on the southwestern flannel hash and split the banana bread French toast with my mother. The food came out crazy fast. Less than ten minutes and it was piping hot!  The hash was wonderful. Packed with amazing flavor and a little bit of a kick to it.  The French toast was out of this world. Extremely decadent and filling.  The service was fast and friendly. Keegan was very knowledgeable of the menu and providing us with feedback. Will definitely come back.

I've been to this place a couple times and this visit was a little disappointing. I usually really look forward to breakfast here. It was probably what I ordered. I thought I'd give their protein pancakes a try but they paled in comparison to my favorite ones made at another Valley restaurant. I do love their DD hash and the banana bread French toast (wow). They have super reasonable bloody Mary's and mimosas. I'll be back for sure.

Really good food! I had the huevos rancheros burger a that was amazing!! The best selection is decent....had a pumpkin porter which was amazing but not enough selection of dark beer. The beer selection itself wasn't the greatest. The bartender was very nice and made sure I had everything I needed, even when she was running around trying to do a million things at once.

I first experienced the Daily Dose in Scottsdale so when I saw they opened a location in the Biltmore area I was super excited!  One evening my husband I were desperately looking around for a place that either delivered or we could pick up take out.  So I mentioned to my hubby about the new Daily Dose around the corner.  They closed at 9 and we literally called at 8:45 to place 2 full meals, and appetizers.  We ordered a full rack of ribs, salmon, and crab cakes as the appetizer.  The entrees came with julienned veggies and a full salad (house or caesar.)  We are not fans of julienned veggies so those were a waste.    However, the salmon was excellent.  I asked for no BBQ and just had it blackened and well-done (which I love!)  I was given a nice amount of salmon, not a small piece.  For it being the end of the night, the fish was cooked nicely and was still fresh.    My husband got a full rack of ribs and those were amazing.  The only possible complaint I might have about those is that they were a bit salty but I don't cook with salt so that might have been it.  The rib meat literally fell off the bone....so incredible!  I am so happy there is a place by us that has delectable ribs.  If you go to Daily Dose for dinner please try the ribs! They are truly delicious!   The crab cakes were quite good; there were three of them atop a bed of a corn salsa.  There were a few sauces including a creme aioli type sauce and green chile salsa.  The cakes were very yummy.   When we stopped in to get our food I asked if it was too late to order a sangria which they said it was- bummer.  But, the kind cute little bartender let me have a generous sample of the frozen sangria from their machine-deeeeeelicious!    I can't wait to go back to try more sangria and also more items from the menu.  This restaurant was a little pricey so bring some money honey! $65 was our total.

How did I not know they put this in?!? The husband and I really enjoy the location in Old Town, but we try to avoid that area as much as possible. So we were thrilled to see they put in a new restaurant closer to our hood.   First of all, let me start by saying that we had some of the best service we've ever received during our lunch here. Our server was casual and friendly, without being overwhelming. He was always strolling by to check on us...we didn't even have to wait for refills. The atmosphere of the place is definitely what I picture when I think of a breakfast joint (even though we were here for lunch). It's cozy, comfortable, and clean. The patio looks awesome, but it was way too hot to try that out this time around. The other thing that will keep me coming back is the menu. They have so many options that look so good! This time around I had the caprese grilled cheese and my husband tried an omelet. Both were super tasty and very filling. We also started with their chips, salsa, and guac,,,also very good.   All in all, we really like this place and we're so happy they're close by now. I'll definitely be back again...for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I love the variety of items they serve in a relaxed environment. Thanks for the great meal and awesome service!

I was here a couple of weeks back for Smunch.  It was during a bitter cold weekend so as cool as the patio looked there was only one bundled up couple.  The place was busy the whole time we were there and several people waiting for seating as we left.  But we, a party of 12, never felt rushed.  Service was very good.  The two waitresses knew the menu and had no problems splitting checks and answering questions.  I had the crabby omelet with DD hash and it was very good and I had trouble stuffing it all in.

Came here yesterday to grab breakfast. I've been here a handful of times since I've moved back but mostly for meetings so I've never really gotten to enjoy the food like this time. We got here about 9:15 and decided to sit at the bar since we had a movie to get to.  Pros  ~Food made just the way you order it..I'm very particular about the way my bacon is cooked    and they made it just how I liked it without having to send it back  ~Never an empty cup...whether it was coffee or water my cup was always topped off ~AMAZING bloody Mary's... The blood Mary was so good that I ordered just the mix so I could take it home and enjoy one at home ~Super friendly staff.. The server knew we were going to the movie and was kind enough to put ice in a plastic bag so I could keep the bloody Mary mix on ice... NOW THAT"S SERVICE!!!  Cons ~Depending on how large your party and what time you get there you may have to wait a little bit. I personally have never had to wait since I'm usually just a plus 1  Overall Daily Dose Midtown gets 4 stars looking forward to coming back soon!

Cute, bright, and a clean place!  Too hot to sit in the patio, so M and I selected to sit inside.  The place got busier and busier as it got closer to noon.  I ordered breakfast because I never wake up early enough to eat it.  LOL!!!  The meat and cheese omelete, toast, potatoes, etc. were all so good.  The service was great.  I loved the green ice tea....  LOVE it.  The server even gave me a cup to go....  SWEET!

I'm sorry to say that I do not agree with the other two reviews.  We stopped at this place to grab a drink and appetizer because we had some time to kill before meeting some friends, and the place looked cute as we were driving by. Service was extremely slow.  Despite all the empty tables on the patio when we came in, we were told 10-15 minutes for a table outside.  We did only wait about 5, but then we waited almost 10 minutes for our server to greet us and take our drink order.  We ordered a beer, a margarita, and chips, salsa and guacamole, and 2 waters with lemon.  5 minutes later the water comes out....without lemon.  Server says she's going to go get our drinks and I ask for lemons also.  She's off, and I take a sip of my water.  Yuck!  Worst water I've ever had at a restaurant, so five minutes later when she brings our drinks and the lemon, I don't even use it because no amount of lemon is going to get rid of the dirt taste in the water.  So now we finally have our drinks and she says our chips and salsa should be up soon.  5 minutes later we get our chips and salsa and guacamole.  What can I say....it tasted like chips, salsa and guacamole.  The whole place just felt kind of lame and depressing.  Staff didn't have much personality.  Overall we were just unimpressed.

We took our second trip to this place today and i was a little disappointed with the service so i had to take away a star. Besides the lack of urgency I got from every employee in the place their food always tastes great. Unfortunately today they served me sunny side up eggs instead of over hard so i had to wait an additional 5 minutes while everyone else at my table ate, but once my food did come, cooked properly, it was tasty! overall this is a great place to grab some breakfast until 4pm any day of the week! i havent tried anything on their lunch or dinner menu, but i plan to go back soon so i can!

First-time diner there. Solid place for lunch. Nice atmosphere inside and I could picture having a nice craft brew on the patio with family or friends. I ordered a burger -- 8 oz. of Kobe, cooked just as I asked, with bacon (mmmmm..bacon...), sauteed onions, basil & lettuce on a pretzel roll. Juicy, tasty, terrific. Should have ordered the 10 oz. version for another $1 more. Very large portion of mixed fries (1/2 reg., 1/2 sweet potato). My colleague had a big veggie burger that she enjoyed, and bowl of sweet potatoes and "other stuff" that was super delicious. Service was attentive and fun. I'll definitely be back. Maybe for "breakfast for lunch" -- the pancake menu (served til 4 p.m.) looked great.

I was not impressed at all with my meal. I had asked for my burger to be medium rare and it was way over done. In addition it really needed salt and pepper to improve the flavor. The DD hash that came with it was very disappointing as well. The butternut squash was way over cooked and mushy and it seems to be swimming in grease. Other items that people ordered at my table looked pretty good however so maybe I will give it another shot one day...

Over all I really like this restaurant lots of food for your budget and genuinely delicious. The waiters and bartenders are great just overwhelmed. Although the hostesses need to work on their attitude. That's the first impression you get when entering the restaurant and both times being here it through me off.  Second time coming here and the food is amazing! Order the potatoes they are so delicious. Orange juice freshly squeezed. Food and drink wise is awesome. And the restaurant atmosphere in general is very inviting.    The only negative thing I would have to put is the service here. Both times I've been here the two hostesses have been giggly and unprofessional. When we asked if there were fans on the outside before we sat out there (it's 104 degrees)  she said "oh no those are for decoration" sarcastically then turned them on and started giggling with the other hostesses   The waitresses and bartenders are great they just seem to get a bit overwhelmed our food and drinks always came out in a good time. Always by a different person though causing confusion.  Go here great place to eat!

Absolute disaster.   It was not that busy, people waiting and standing for anyone to not only greet but to be seated as well.  Food is good but not worth the horrible service.  It felt like only one person was working even though I saw a full staff.  This is my last time.  Save yourself the trouble and eat across the street at Twin Peaks.

The husband and I stopped in here last night for some drinks before grocery shopping. It was a good time.  When we arrived at 4pm, it was really dead. We were pretty much the only ones in there. But they let us know right away that we were just in time for happy hour (woohoo!). So we each ordered a drink (he had a beer and then a specialty coffee, I had 3 spiked arnold palmers). The drinks were fantastic! Our waitress was also the bartender, which was cool. We also ordered a couple soft pretzels to start us off. OMG they were good! Super soft with 2 different delicious dipping sauces. Soooo good. Then, we ordered a veggie burger on a pretzel bun and split it. It was big, the waitress put it on two plates for us, we didn't even ask! Super sweet of her. It comes with ketchup and two other sauces. I think one was a cucumber sauce, and the other was just delicious. I have no idea what it is.  We hung out and people watched for a few hours. There was some good people watching to be had. The place was pretty mellow, and right down the street from our house. I'm hesitant to put more great details because I really like this place and don't want it to blow up. lol But I will say, we will definitely be going again.

Meh. That's all I really had to say after eating here. Service was absolutely great, no complaints about that whatsoever. Food on the other hand, not the greatest. I got the chorizo and jalape√±o corn cakes. Pretty disappointed, too dry and hardly any chorizo. Husband got the nuts and berries French toast. He said it was just okay. I tried it, way too sweet for me. I might come back but definitely would try something different. Maybe their lunch is better? Overall it we just okay. You're not missing out on anything if you've never been here.

This place was really good. It is on the corner of a strip mall. I had the chopped salad with crispy chicken. I got the half size and couldn't eat it all. Also eaten at the table was cinnamon pancakes and a eggs Benedict. I took a bit of the pancakes. They were yummy. Not overly sweet like some can be. I would return to this place again if in the area.

I went to The Daily Dose Midtown for lunch. It wasn't very busy so I easily found myself a seat. After reviewing the extensive menu I decided on the Cobb Sandwich which was a delicious grilled chicken breast with blue cheese, lettuce, tomato and I'm probably leaving a few things off, on a pretzel bun. It came with a side (but I was accidentally offered two) of which I chose the sweet potato hash (cubed sweet potatoes, mushrooms and onions), and a side of fruit.  I thought everything was delicious. Would I go back? Absolutely. I caught a peek at someone's salad and it looked amazing. Huge, but amazing. I can't wait to try one next time.

I went to Daily Dose for Sunday breakfast and was ignored for about 10 minutes after being seated.  As I was picking up my phone to call the restaurant to request some coffee, a server appeared.  The young lady appeared irritated that we were there but took our drink order.  Someone must have noticed because a short while later a friendly gal came by to take over our service.    I had the mixed berry protein pancakes and they were delicious!  Long story short....a weird experience with the service that ended on a positive note and phenomenal food.  Will definitely give this place another try.

My friend and I have been stopping here for breakfast for the past 3 or 4 weeks.  I am very impressed in the consistency of the food and service.  When I go out for breakfast I am not looking for fine dinning service.  I just want my drink and my food, a little conversation, and then my bill.  Daily Dose caters to all my expectations of what a breakfast joint should be. Laid back good food, and service with a smile!  Thanks for becoming my morning go to spot!

Great beer selection.  Nice atmosphere.  Good food.  Good service.  A little pricey, but they do have an awesome happy hour that makes it affordable.  I really don't have much to say bad about this place, but something is off and I cannot give it 3 or 4 stars when I would choose about two or three other places to go to in the area before coming there.  They do serve brunch, so if that is your thing maybe throw in an extra star, but its not something I seek out personally.

Excellent choice for lunch. Wife had the steak and eggs. They were excellent and the Home made mixed berry jam for the twist was also superb. Panko chicken fingers is also an excellent choice here. Very attentive staff. We will definitely be back soon.

DD is the go to spot when friends and I are looking to get together for breakfast and I've never had a bad experience here.  The staff is great.  They're attentive and friendly.  I like that the manager can always be seen going around asking tables how their meal was.  I had to send something back once and he brought it back and apologized which I appreciated.  Mimosas are good.  Coffee is great.  I go so much that I try to have something different every time, but a girl is always going to have her favorites.  I had the Hangover sandwich last Saturday.  It was delicious.  I don't know what they do to their bacon, maybe they made love to it, but whatever they do it works.   Their Veggie omelette is really good.  Their bagel & lox is something that I'd have no problems not ordering ever again, you're better off having Einstein bros.  Traditional burger is a solid good burger.  I tried their Southwest Flannel Hash recently and it's different.  I haven't quite made up my mind on it yet.  Our server said they make it from scratch, which I love, but maybe if they grilled it to be well done it'd be better. Comes out looking like a pot roast.  I might give it another try before I write it off completely, but I can always stick to their DD hash.

I was excited to try a new place that my coworkers recommended. One of my coworkers and I ordered the exact same salad, with chicken, and dressing on the side. As we placed our order, we even commented on it being exactly the same. When the food came, they brought me the wrong salad. When we pointed out the error, the server trounced back into the kitchen and pronounced loudly enough that I could hear it across the restaurant "she ordered a Cobb". Several minutes later, the correct salad appeared, but no dressing on the side. When we asked for dressing, they brought it out and I started to eat the salad. About 3 bites in, I realized that they HAD put plenty of dressing on the salad so I wasn't going to be able to eat it. I ate the chicken breast off the top and that was it. Oh, and I found bacon in the salad, which I can't eat (wasn't supposed to be on the correct salad) which means they just scraped the ingredients off of the original salad and threw new toppings on. Why would I order the Cobb salad, knowing it had bacon on it if I can't eat bacon? The server came to clear the plates and asked if I wanted a box. I said no. Clearly I hadn't eaten any of the salad. She asked if something was wrong and I pointed out that it was drenched in dressing and had bacon on it, which means I couldn't eat it. She said "oh, the dressing was supposed to be on the side" and then she SET MY BILL IN FRONT OF ME. Are you kidding me?!? She served me food TWICE that I couldn't eat, she blamed me for one error and admitted to the other error and still thought that billing me $15 for a half a salad was a good idea? So we ask for the manager. When he originally came over, he had attitude about it as well because the server told him that I had misordered and that's why they had to remake the salad. When we explained the whole situation, he totally understood that it was the servers fault and even bagged on her for not manning up to making the mistake in the first place. He went ahead and took care of my bill, which is the only reason for the 2 star review. Bottom line-that server should be terminated. She made the mistake, she tried to blame the customer (loudly enough that every customer in the joint could hear her) and then made another mistake and didn't own up to any of it?!? Ridiculous! In the end, I won't be back. Neither will my coworkers. The manager tried to make it right, but one right doesn't fix three wrongs.

Food is delicious. Servers are really sweet. But the hostess's are super unprofessional. I didn't feel welcomed like I should have been , when I walked in. Overall though, I highly recommend the food here :) super yummy , just beware of the rude hostess's. Don't allow them to ruin your experience.

I've never had a negative experience, from the food to the laid back ambiance, friendly staff and deliciously crafted good-- it's worth any lengthy wait for a table, which you may encounter on a Sunday morning.   My personal lunch favorite is the gladiator burger. The red chile cheese sauce is mouth watering. P.s., ask for Haley-- she's the greatest!
Amazing breakfast! Substitute the toast for the whole wheat pancake and you will not be disappointed.
Big portions and so much variety!

Great location. Friendly professional service. Sass made a tremendous recommendation of the Flannel Hash Benedict with the saut√©ed squash and mushrooms side. OMG they were fantastic together. Wife had tender and delicious chicken and waffles. Enough for leftovers.  You cannot make a better choice for breakfast.  I'LL BE BACK

If your in the area stop by , this place is awesome and the people are great . Erica and Andrea behind the bar friendly and will greet you with a smile . This place gets packed with people so timing is everything . But it's worth the time to eat great healthy food !

After five visits, the service keeps getting worse. I thought I'd try take out to avoid that but even that person was just plain angry. I'm a server too, and I LOVE my job and use my hour with people to make others days better... Maybe try that?

Awesome place to dine. One word to describe this place: Welcoming. From the hostess, to the waiting staff, the clean, positive atmosphere, this restaurant is 10 out a 10 in my book. Located off of Highland Ave minutes from the Bitmore, this down-to-earth eatery is very well priced, serves spectacular food with good portions and even offers our heroes in uniform a military discount (but only active duty).   Great for family outings and date night (or mornings).  I enjoyed my breakfast here, to the fullest. Satisfaction guaranteed.

Brunch or Drunch, you really can never go wrong with the Dos!  We had breakfast nachos (Ridiculous!), regular nachos, bacon and eggs, French toast and a cheeseburger!  Yeah, that's brunch!  Dog friendly too!!

We've had good experiences here before, but today didn't cut it. We sat at the bar so we could watch some Sunday football. The bartender greeted us quickly and got our drink order. The Bloody Mary I ordered was horrible. Very watered down and tasted like they put a shot of olive juice in it. I asked if she could spice it up which she tried to do. It didn't help. I ordered the southwestern wrap, it was ok. The avocado's were not ripe and had seed peal left on them. My husband had a burger..it was ok, nothing great.  Overall, service wasn't up to par nor was the food...to many other good choices around. Don't think I'll be back.

If you come here for brunch on a Saturday, be prepared to wait, yet their delicious coffee that is available for free in the waiting area makes it worth waiting.   We were 7 of us and I'll highlight the general experience, but I'll focus on my dish more than others'. I ordered the turkey sausage white out off of the health nut section. I substituted the toast with butternut squash. The meal also comes with fruit.   Tasty, delicious, healthy and filling. I enjoyed it Thoroughly and cleaned my plate. It was a busy day, but service was pretty consistent. I also ordered pomegranate green tea and it was refreshed and replenished in a timely manner. One thing that was disappointing is that my meal came with no fruit and server noticed it right away and instead of bringing a bowl of fruit, took my large bowl of butternut squash,  and came back with a smaller bowl of butternut squash and a large bowl of fruit. Didn't make sense to me, but wasn't the end of the world. All in all the food is delicious, and service was consistent.
Breakfast delicious, service was excellent, our server even offered us a to go cup for their ice tea (unlimited refills). The outside patio is beautiful.

Great place, nice to have a little local bar in the neighborhood that instantly fits in with the local flavor. I have been there many times already in just the short time they have been open. The, staff are all very attentive and friendly. The food is good and averagly priced. A great little place to stop by after work.

Well.... being we are regulars here and we love it I'm very sad to update my review. But today we had a pretty negative experience here with the service. We eat here I'd say 3 times a week. Every Saturday for sure. We have grown to know many of the people working there including the manager. Today we came in about 915am it wasn't super busy but there wasn't many tables. The girl that works the door is just not friendly and every time we go in a I get a rather rude vibe from her. Well she tells us "i need a min" not hello or anything just that. So they sat another table and came back to seat us. Now the host didn't set us the manager did. Aaron. So he offers us a table in the middle of the restaurant, my boyfriend and I wanting to enjoy our breakfast and having some business we were looking to go over we asked if we could wait for a booth. Aaron seemed to be annoyed by our request. So we went back to the front to wait. We got seated at a new booth. We sat for about 5 to 10 mins and  Aaron finally brought over some water for us not saying a thing just dropping it on the table in a rude manner and walking off. So at this point being we come here all the time we didn't need to look at the menu we were ready to order but the waitress who we both saw the waitress get drinks as take everyone else's table. I let it go the first time. But the 2nd time she came to our section she attended every table and yet again walked right by us not saying a thing. At this point I'm annoyed and say to my boyfriend I feel like i want to leave we have been here 20 mins at this table with a server walking past us 3 times not acknowledging us one time I just want to leave. Well Aaron either overhearing me say this or just seeing our body language came over to say "has anyone taken your drink order?" Me saying "no no one has said a thing to us since we sat here" my boyfriend asks me at that point if I want to leave. I say "yes" Aaron did say at that time. "Ill get something going for you guys" I told him no thank you. You see us 2 or more times a week and this is the service you give. He said sorry and seemed to not be happy about us leaving but at this point we were hungry had been here for 40 mins and no sign of being able to eat or even order. The demeanor of the host and the manager seemed off and rude. We are very nice people and were just blown away. I'm sad to do this update but today our view changed on the service here and there are other daily doses we will go to from here on out.

The food at this restaurant was fairly average and the service on the morning I was there was not exactly the best. We waited a while for a table, then did not place our orders for a while afterward. Once our orders were placed, tables around us that arrived after us received their food before we did. When we got our food, we agreed that the food was just average in quality. Not bad, but nothing to go crazy over. I would be willing to give this restaurant another shot.

Awful service.  Been here 4-5 times in the last 6 months, same exact expereince each time.  Waiters/waitresses disappear into the back and sneak back out without making eye contact to provide the absolute minimum service required.  I don't understand how this place is still open.
I really enjoyed my lunch here.  Great salads, great sandwiches, and a very good drink/bar selection.  It is a nice bonus that they served breakfast all day on the weekends too.
Great place to have breakfast. Couldn't decide on what I really wanted and the waitress was extremely helpful. The pancakes are AMAZING! Probably the best I've had in a very long time.

Normally, I go into these places and then look over the ho-hum menu and get something typical like a burger, but this place has a really exciting menu with all sorts of somewhat unusual food combos.  I'd like to keep coming back and trying them all, frankly, as some of them sounded really interesting. Had the chicken nachos--which certainly was loaded with diced chicken--and felt positively stuffed afterwards.  Granted, I could have boxed up half of it and brought it home but what fun is that?  I can't say it was the best nacho dish I ever had (let's face it, it's all the sloppy sour cream and cheese that makes it sooo fattening but good)...but it WAS filling.  Very.  You get ALOT for your money here of nutritious chicken anyway...good deal!  And not all that fattening since they don't heap on sour cream and cheese but alot of healthy chicken.  Good dish for dieters. Good happy hour menu which lasts from 4-8pm with $2.75 domestic beers on the menu. Good service here, by the way.  Nice people serving a tremendous crowd with a smile no less.  Can't beat that for an evening out.

Seated fast and the service was solid.  We were a large group and it was just after 8am.  Went with the breakfast nacho plate along with my friend.  Everyone in the group seemed to enjoy eating our dishes more than their own.  Some did not even finish what they ordered....soda was flat 4 out of 4 glasses too.

This place is good! Our server was andrea and she was great. We were seated right away, and though we took forever to decide what we wanted, once we ordered our food hit the table in under 10 minutes. I think my only complaint was that my coffee mug was pretty dirty, but other then that everything was delicious. Not my go to, but always a good place when you want to switch it up!

I don't have a negative thing to say about Daily Dose!  I eat here at least once a month for brunch and have brought friends and family alike, all of whom love it now too. It's biking distance from my house, but so is Snooze and let's just say I have only been there once.   The staff at Daily Dose is super friendly, quick and even when there is a wait, they provide free (delicious) coffee.  The food is amazing as well, and being as I have Celiac Disease, the fact they offer gluten free pancakes is basically a dream come true!  This has become and will likely stay my go-to brunch spot!

Came here with a work associate for lunch and was blown away by the quality of the food and quick service! There aren't a ton of great-tasting establishments in this area, so when you find one, it really stands out. This place is one of them.  I ordered a Daily Dose Burger with Chipotle Mac & Cheese. The burger was cooked exactly as I had asked and was very flavorful. Whatever sauce they put on it is hands down the best complement to a burger I've seen or tasted. Now on to the mac & cheese: right amount of kick with a creamy/cheesy consistency that rivaled some of my favorite soul food restaurants. Our server Kylie was super attentive and always made sure our experience was the best it can be. I will definitely be coming back here for lunch again in the future.

I love this place!  I've eaten here here five times since they opened and every meal has been delicious.  I've had the Mediterranean salad, Cobb salad with crab cakes on top, turkey burger with sweet potato fries. Crab cake sandwich and an omelet.  What is great is you can get breakfast anytime.  Give the establishment a chance to work out a few kinks AND read the menu - very descriptive.
Delicious food. There was a mistake with our order last time and the manager went above and beyond to rectify the mistake.

Everything on this menu looks so darn good. I was debating bt the hangover sandwich and the mixed berry pancakes. Waitress suggested sandwich bc she doesn't like waffles. Apparently I picked the two most popular items.  Sandwich just ok. I thought it would have been more bold in flavor after reading the descrip - bacon, sausage, aioli type sauce, caramelized jalape√±os and onions. Nothing really stood out to me.  But that won't stop me from going back to try others.  Saw a pic of the breakfast nachos and they look AMAZING.  Another  waitress said it was the best thing in the menu so will have to see how legit that recommendation is. Will have to try that and my pancakes next time.  They have this ginger snap granola that I got to sample. Pretty yummy considering I am not a fan of granola.  Service was interesting. In the beg and all the way up to when our food was served, we had people constantly checking up on us. But once our food was served, I only saw our waitress once during the entire meal.  Not even the other two people who were so good about helping us. It took forever to find one of them to get our check. And we had sat there for a good 5-10 minutes after we finished eating. Weird inconsistency.  We'll see how it goes the 2nd time.

Unfortunately I just don't make it out to breakfast often enough...but we recently decided to try this place as we happened to be in the area.  What a great little spot!   I ordered the poblano and polenta cakes eggs Benedict and I really enjoyed it.  I am a savory breakfast gal and I love anything with a Mexican flare.  I wasn't a huge fan of their potatoes...there was an herb in there I wasn't digging.  But that's just personal preference. I also tried some of my hubby's biscuits and gravy which were very good and very unique.   Good sized portions and good prices.  The kids enjoyed waffles and pancakes so I got to sample both and they were both DELICIOUS!  Obviously this was a splurge kind of day but they have many healthy options and I look forward to returning to try them out.   Service was friendly and fantastic!

Came in today to grab a quick bite with my mom. We sat at the bar and were greeted by Andrea who was a great bartender! She provided some recommendations and was friendly. I went with the Mint Strawberry salad...SO good! The salad is huge and they don't skimp on any of the ingredients whether it's the mint, strawberries, gorgonzola or almonds. My mom had the Southwestern Chopped; it was good but I'd suggest adding chicken to it for more flavor.  The overall atmosphere was good; it wasn't crowded, had a nice breeze from the patio and it was clean.   I'm giving the Midtown Daily Dose 4 stars only because I haven't tried enough of the food to really push that 5 star button.
We had a last minute call-in/take-out lunch order for 17 people.  JenLyn and the crew were able to accommodate our order.  The food was great and the people just as awesome.  Thanks JenLyn!

I give 3.5 stars for breakfast.  Never had lunch or dinner.  Great breakfast place, Turkey Sausage Omelette,  Hangover Sandwich and Southwest Breakfast wrap are my favorites.  One of the few god breakfast place in the area.

This place is around the corner from my office and is in a very convenient location in proximity to the Biltmore area.   I really enjoyed myself and the burger that I ordered, and based on the diet I'm on they were super accommodating separating it out for me the way that I needed it (annoying, I know, it's temporary).  The waitress was very sweet and the place was super clean.    I will be back for sure. :)
Once of my favorite places to go.  Love to split a couple of the dishes for breakfast.... super coffee.   The decor is fantastic.  Have never been disappointed with the service... always excellent.

I really like this place.   The decor is beautiful, the food is good and their specialty drinks are incredible.  They have a very nice patio.  The staff and bartenders were very friendly and even other customers here seem very friendly.  This is very close to my home and I come here at least once a week.
I had a spicy bloody mary, the polenta and pablano eggs benedict, all very very tasty.  I will definately come here again.

This was the WORST experience ever.  The bartender slash server slash, woke up hung over smelled like alcohol had last nights party make up on, was not only rude but very un attentive.  It was almost like I was a burden for her....  Thankfully the food was great.  But I would NEVER EVER recommend this place to anyone looking for a great service type of experience. And the host...  Don't even get me started. She was terribly rude.  Her face and demeanor said it all when  We walked in.  and being from and In the industry I get it...  But she needs to learn what the industry is.  horrible front of the house staff! terrible first impression!  This place needs help! I will continue to go there and bring friends.  And if this kind of behavior is acceptable...  Especially what a great location you have...    We shall see how long it takes till ur establishment falls to pieces. Weed out the weak links before ur weeded out.  Terrible terrible terrible...  See u soon
I would give this place more stars but they took off my favorite entr√©e,  the chicken and biscuits.  So disappointed

Place was packed for brunch, but luckily our friends arrived first and picked up a table before we showed up.  It was super busy, but the staff attended to us in a timely manner.  Poor waitress had to keep coming back, because we were chatting instead of looking for something to order. Two of us had the Hangover sandwich, one friend ordered the Crabby omelette ,and I had the Southwest Flannel Hash.  Everyhing was pleasantly devoured.  Really liked my hash dish.  Should have ordered some biscuits to go with it...and some bacon.  Buddy and I ordered bacon bloody marys.  They were ok.  They lacked some zing.  Should have asked for them to be spicy.    Good spot for breakfast for brunch.  Think everyone else knows that too, so be prepared to wait for a table.

I had the soft pretzels and chorizo mac and cheese.  I was really looking forward to moist soft pretzels with some great cheese... the cheese was watery and was not enough for the very dry pretzel.  It really needed salt and butter to make it taste more than just plain bread, or much more cheese to dip it in.  The chorizo mac and cheese sounded delicious and like it would be somewhat spicy, but it was VERY bland.  When I added salt, it wasn't as bad... but it was still very meh.  Not remotely spicy or flavorful.  For the price (I spent 18 bucks on these two things), I've definitely had better.  Which bums me out, I've been wanting to try this place since they opened as their menu sounded delicious, with many things that I thought I would love.  Happy hour prices were meh.  5 dollar margaritas, 3.75 well, which are comparable or more expensive than any other bar in the area.  Not really worth my time again, and glad I didn't take my boyfriend as he would have likely complained about paying for that.  Did not try the breakfast... which is what everyone seems to be raving about.  If you're going, try it for that but skip the dinner menu for sure.

J and I went here for a quick breakfast the day after Christmas.  We had Baby C in tow with us.    Can I just say that our waitress was AWESOME!!!  I was changing Baby C's diaper in the bathroom and well, let's just say that his whole outfit needed to be changed.  Oh and the ladies bathroom had a diaper changing station!  So helpful for patrons with little ones still in diapers!  Anyway....By the time I finished cleaning him up and got back to our table.  Our food had already been dropped off.  BUT, my food was no where in sight.  The waitress asked J if she could put my order back up on the pass so it would stay hot.  So when I got back to our table, a minute later, my breakfast arrives.    My breakfast - Peanut Butter and Jelly Pancakes!  Super tasty!    As we were getting ready to leave, I asked our waitress if we could have to go cups for our drinks (my water and J's soda).  She not only brought cups, but they were filled with our beverages.    Seriously awesome grub and service!!

Love this place! The food is always good, the service is attentive, and coffee outstanding.  You must try the Banana Bread French Toast or the Strawberry Belgian Waffle! We are always seated quickly aand drinks offfered right away. This is a must-visit place!

Second brunch here. The menu is varied and hits most tastes. The steak and eggs is wonderful looking, plan to try next visit. Had the DD hash which is really something. Group of four covered the gamut for entries and all were happy. We had a Creme Br√ªl√©e pancake that we all shared and it was wonderful. Staff is extremely helpful and prompt Note this is a busy place and if you show at 11 AM on a Sunday there will be a bit of a wait, however it is worth it! Seats in the dining room are great but sitting at the bar is fun as well. Give these guys a visit, you will not regret it!

Great all around! Excellent service, as well as lots of delicious drinks and foods to choose from. Went for brunch at 12pm on a Sunday and there was no wait; we were seated right away and our waiter was very attentive. Will definitely be coming back.

I have been wanting to try this place for a long time.  Last week was my chance.  Some friends wanted to grab dinner, so we decided on Daily Dose Midtown.  When we arrived it was pretty quiet. It was a Saturday night so I was a little surprised.  Our waitress was nice but slightly flaky.  Every time we asked her a question and she didn't know the answer, she tried to guess the answer rather than just asking someone. Especially when it came to a friend asking about something she is allergic to. She gave us incorrect information on the portion size of an appetizer and she forgot a few things like my friends beer and then said "Oh that's my fault" when he asked if it was coming.  This all went on when it was pretty slow so that to me is either a sign of someone new (which that didn't seem to be the case) or someone just being lazy because it's a slow night.  Her personality was a bit too casual too.  Just enough to be boarder line unprofessional. Not a big deal, it was just noticeable.    The food was ok.  I had a hamburger and I asked for it Medium,  I got what seemed to me to be medium well or even well done. There wasn't any pink at all.  The pretzel bun also seemed kind of dry.  At this point I wasn't going to bother bringing it up to the waitress.    What all seem like bad things, I just had a feeling it was the staff of that night.  The following week some coworkers wanted to go there for lunch so we did.  I figured this would give me an idea of this place.  Right off the service was MUCH better.  Our waitress was attentive and got everything right.  Just her demeanor and professionalism seemed a lot better. The food improved too and it was all in all a better experience.  I think our first time here was a case of the lazy restaurant workers who just didn't want to be there on a Saturday night.   Would I recommend?  Yes, give it a try.  I think I really want to try brunch.

My first time to DD. Nice patio seating and easy parking, nice location. Wednesday am, not too busy. I ordered the orange juice and it was fresh squeezed and delicious as promised. I ordered the strawberry and cream waffle. Soooo good! I really liked the pastry pastry cream on the waffle and a nice rich whiped cream. It was wonderful and not too sweet.  I wasn't crazy about the sausage patties but I'm into more spicy vs herbaceous.   My friend had the chicken enchiladas and loved em! Especially since they were done on flour tortillas. We'll be back!

I wish I went there more.  Great happy hour draft specials.  Not just bud or coors, but real microbrews on tap.  Never had a bad meal there, I highly recommend the veggie omelet for breakfast and the chicken nachos and a beer during happy hour.

I went here with my boss one time and even though the food was good, I was extremely confused because of the hours this restaurant has. They have very odd hours and if I remember correctly, they aren't open on weekend either. They must make all of their money during lunch breaks. I probably wouldn't go here often even though it is right around the corner from my work.

Deliciousness - 3.5/5 Happiness - 4/5  Along with Snooze, Daily Dose is one of my go-to spots for breakfast. Daily Dose has a pretty extensive (and delicious) lunch menu in addition to its breakfast offerings. One of my personal favorite items is their rosemary potatoes with some incredibly delicious cr√®me fraiche (plus, cr√®me fraiche reminds me of that South Park episode - another plus). While nothing overly stands out, you get a high-quality meal in a clean atmosphere (no sticky, syrup-smelling tables here) with a staff that always is friendly.  The only caveat, be ready for a wait. The location is a bit small and during rush hour, there is often a line out the door. They usually have free water and coffee while you wait, which is very considerate.

My new weekend breakfast joint! Love this location and a friendly staff that's always helpful and ready to serve you.  For breakfast, I've had the egg Benedict.  The first time the eggs were cooked perfectly, but the second time a bit over done.  Still yummy and worth the cost.  The biscuits and gravy were ok, not the best and a bit odd in taste-needed salt or seasoning.  I have not tried out their happy hour at this location.  I've tried it at Scottsdale location which I wasn't really impressed.  This location however, I really like and will keep going!
I'll def be back. I really liked there coffee normally I dont like breakfast joint coffee. I liked the breakfast nachos and my son enjoyed his kids meal large portion for only $5

Been here many times and continue to receive the same excellent service and consistently amazing food, never to disappoint. The servers are always pleasant, professional, fun and provide fantastic recommendations. As a result, my list of favorites continue to grow. Always looking forward to our next visit. Keep up the great work. Thank you!!!
This place is great, huge selection so it can accommodate a big party with lots of different tastes. Quick, easy and affordable

This place is GREAT! Beautiful decor with very interesting architecture and an outdoor patio; fast, friendly service; excellent food, great looking staff. ... I'm surprised it was so easy to get a seat! But it was pouring rain, so that maybe why. ... The Flannel corn beef was excellent, and is homemade, not the kind that comes in a can from far away. I ordered eggs poached soft and YES, they came out soft, just right! ... Coffee (Americano) was great too. ... OH! And they have hooks under the counter and good Wifi!

I grabbed dinner and some brews at Daily Dose Midtown with my friend last night. Great food, great beers, great prices! The burger was exquisite, and with the happy hour prices going 4-9 daily, my adoration for places like Smashburger is in peril. I'm looking forward to future meals at Daily Dose, and plan on returning super soon!
They have the best mimosa ! We usually come here after work for breakfast and drinks. They are very friendly and food is great.

I would recommend the huevos rancheros. I don't know what I was expecting but it was incredible. The bean salsa was so amazing. My daughter had the turkey sausage and polenta bowl which she enjoyed very much. The service was also exceptional.

First time to this location and it was ok.  Customer service was nice they were friendly and outgoing. The food however, was missing a lot of flavor. Last time I came to daily dose (Scottsdale location) I ordered the eggs Benedict which I thought were pretty tasty. This time I ordered the turkey sausage omelette with house potatoes and fruit. The house potatoes definitely tasted frozen and some were half way cooked, which wasn't very pleasant. The omelette lacked a lot of flavor, it was extremely bland. I ordered  coffee and not bad (since I am the pickiest when it comes to coffee). My partner ordered a bacon burger and his too lacked a lot of seasoning.    They have a small bar once you walk in and also have a patios to sit outdoors. Currently they are remodeling the frys next door so there's a lot of construction in that are (parking can be a hassle)  All in all daily dose is an ok place I would only stick to eggs Benedict from now on if i were to come back here.

Went here for my weekly breakfast adventure. The wait was really short although it seemed like we hit the hostess stand at the right time. We were seated and served our large coffee relatively quick. Let me emphasize the large coffee cups they provide.   Raymond was our waiter and he was very helpful and truly a pleasure. I ordered the Corned Beef Hash which was fantastic. My first question was.... Do they make their own? He said "yes, we roast it fresh in house." Fresh it was! Fantastic, I would recommend that to any Corned Beef Lovers!   I will be back and appreciate their offerings. I might need to come back for the Banana Bread French Toast. YUM

Just took a trip saw my parents in AZ, we stopped by here on the way to the PHX Airport, and it was a GREAT MEAL!   They have a small waiting area with free coffee and cucumber water. There is outdoor seating with heaters (t was cold and raining) and in door seating. The place at first looks small, but I went to the bathroom and it's quite large.   Our server Susan was excellent. They serve double size mugs of coffee and CUCUMBER WATER!   I got the hash, I would give 3.5 stars, just because it was different than I was expecting, but it was 100% unique. It kind of reminded me of soft brisket. The Toast is the kind you get other places, I got Rye, but they served homemade jam. It reminded me of crush blackberry with no added sugar, VERY GOOD.   I tried some Tempeh my Mom got it was good, and then I got some of my Dad's potatoes, which were tasty.   I would 100% eat here again, they have many unique menu items and as Susan said, everything is made in HOUSE, so that's a reason TO GO! =)

Pretty much the rudest host ever!! How long is the wait "I don't know!" What kind of answer is that. Said he didn't have a table for 5 asked if we could do a four top pull up a high chair and he said "I just said I don't have a table!" Ummm you said you didn't have a table for 5 not 4!?!? Seriously completely rude and unwelcoming and we haven't even sat down down.  **waitress and food awesome -update

First time going to this hidden corner gem. Walking in to smiles and a long breakfast/drink bar....we were seated quickly...drinks came out in less than 30 Seconds...orders were placed and food came out looking and tasting fresh and professional. Great prime rib dip sandwich on pretzel bun and my wife got the chopped salad...added chicken. Reasonable prices...will be going back again.

Miss Sass, our waitress, made our experience that much better. She was knowledgeable, always smiling, helpful and fast! She helped us order the right dishes and drinks to compliment each other. The food was incredible, had so much bursting flavor with every bite and we had no problem licking our plates clean. Our next Arizona trip, we will return with the whole family! :)

I was craving pancakes or waffles for breakfast (a very rare occasion--i'm more of an omelette + potatoes girl) and ended up here. They have quite a few selections for pancakes, waffles, and belgian waffles on the menu. I got the strawberries and chocolate pancakes (minus the whipped cream) with butter squash hash, aka the DD hash. The pancakes were alright at best, and they literally put thin slices of strawberries in between the layers of the pancake which, IMO, made it soggy at the end. The DD hash was unique and I enjoyed the flavor.   The service was quick, there are seats indoors, by the bar, and out in the patio. There's also plenty of parking. After looking over their comprehensive menu more, I'd be back again and try one of the omelettes that they're famous for.

First off the food is mediocre. The bacon was burnt and fell into ashes when you bit it.  The coffee was yummy tho. I had the 'filthy chi' Our server was either tired, angry or indifferent.  I I I can't tell which. We had the 'pleasure' of having her at both of our visits and it was the same.  She would drop off the food without a word. We asked for jam for bread. She looked at us.  Walked away. Returned with jam. No words exchanged. Lol.  Honestly why do people work in the service industry when they can't even fake being nice.  I won't go back. The food wasn't enough to make up for the service.

I really enjoyed the BBQ chicken flatbread pizza and the accompanying salad during happy hour.  It was a perfectly portioned, tasty and healthy meal for around only $11.00.  We went to Daily Dose again tonight, and I was greatly looking forward to this favorite meal of mine.  Unfortunately, we learned tonight that this item had recently been removed from the menu!  I enjoy the service and the ambiance at this restaurant, as well as the moderate prices.  But, much as I stopped eating at California Pizza Kitchen after they eliminated my beloved roasted garlic chicken pizza there, I am not likely to eat at Daily Dose much in the future, as my most favorite dish there has been eliminated as well.  (Kudos, though, to the Sunday evening manager, whose name I didn't catch, as she graciously offered to attempt to specially prepare this item for me if I came back in on a Sunday.  I may just take her up on her offer...!)

Wow, what a waste. So after waiting half an hour for our appetizers which one was chips and salsa we waited another half hour for food which we were told would be up shortly. We needed to go as we had somewhere to be and the rate it was going it felt like it would be another half hour before we saw our actual meal.
