I would think they would comp our appetizers for the inconvenience but no sure enough they brought us a bill. Lame bad start. The appetizers were mediocre at best. The guy said to give them a break because it was their 6th day open. They had at least 4 servers and 3 bussers, was their only one cook in the back? I didn't know it took 30 minutes to arrange chips on a plate! I would give this place a second chance, I will wait until they are on their 30th day open and maybe by then they will have figured a few things out about service.

I went to this restaurant for a group get together, 10 people. There was adequate seating for all of us. The food was prompt, fresh, and tasted amazing.....   But when we got our bills, we were a little surprised. The drink menus on the table and the dinner menus had different prices than our bills. When I asked the waitress what was going on, she said she forgot to tell us about the price differences. The restaurant changed prices.  It was not one item but several items.   Needless to say 10 people will no longer frequent this place.Different prices from menus to bills is shady business.
They have super yummy food and great service! They even have turkey sausage! Everything is made fresh including the sausage.

Delicious breakfast, and great service by our server Alexis. The rest of the staff was also very attentive and made sure everything was pleasant. The portions were large and the place had a nice view in the patio area. Everything was good and tasted as expected. It was a great first experience. I'll definitely recommend to friends and family.

Daily Dose has been on my "to try" list for quiet a while, and I'm glad to say it did not disappoint.  I came for brunch on Fourth of July. They had some delicious sounding cocktails and great beers on tap. Unfortunately, I had to go home and study after breakfast so I did not partake. But the happy hour menu looked great, and I will definitely be back to try that. Although I did notice beers are $4 during happy hour, which seems a little high for happy hour. On the bright side, wine is $5 or you can get a bottle for $18. And happy hour is everyday from 4pm to 8pm. If only every happy hour was that long!  I ordered the breakfast nachos- chorizo, eggs, and cheese on tortilla chips. The nachos themselves were pretty good, but a little on the cold side. The portion size is also ridiculous--you could definitely share it with another person. It comes with a side of sausage gravy, which I thought would be weird, but not only was it delicious with the nachos, it was just as good by itself. I will definitely order the biscuits and gravy next time, just so I can have more of that gravy!   My boyfriend ordered the cinnamon apple pancakes. He is a bit of a pancake snob, but he loved these. He was generous enough to share a bite with me, and they are definitely praise worthy. It was like eating apple pie in pancake form.  Our server was great even though she was also working behind the bar. All in all, it was a great breakfast, and I look forward to going back!
4 star review only because the waitress messed up my whole breakfast order, but the food is always good.  Get there expecting to wait, there is always a wait time.  Great spot for brunch.
This place has a great bar and large selection of alcohol. The food is delish and my server was very nice.  The hostess seems a bit severe but was very professional.

The wine wasn't very good. I found their new cabernet to be too tart.  I liked the interior decor. Especially that wooden panel wall that you see when you first walk in.  The tables are nice and artsy. I like the lights that they have, trendy but not too pretentious about it.   The happy hour menu is nice, gives you lots of choices.   The regular menu is ok, I had a hard time deciding on something because there just seemed to be something off about all the dishes. I just couldn't put my finger on what it was that didn't click with me.  The server recommended two dishes, I picked the chicken and waffles combo she liked. It came out and the spicy chicken was good, but the jalapeno waffles were way too heavy for that dish. I couldn't eat more than a few bites because it was so heavy.  The Caesar salad came with tomatoes, and it really made the salad good. Too much Parmesan, but that's being picky.  Service was fine, someone new was training in so we had two different people working our booth.   The food and menu were average overall, the execution is just off at this place.

So their portebello brie fondu appetizer is so delicious. It kinda just tastes like very good creme of mushroom soup. The veggies it comes with is three slices of tomatoes, carrots, and cucumber.  Their pretzels and cheese is pretty okay. Hardly comes with enough cheese sauce and it costs 75 cents to get more cheese....  However, if you order the chips with salsa and guac, you can have unlimited amount of chips.

Came here today for the first time for breakfast with my daughter. Service was great. I had the crab cake eggs benedict and my daughter had the kids' pancake stack. A little bit pricey, but for the food and service definitely worth it. Will be back.

Wow, the berry pancakes with banana and grain are so good. I'll definitely be back.  I can see where the waiting staff might have some timing issues. There seemed to be an overly relaxed vibe amongst the staff which left me scratching my head.  But the food more then made up for it and they did pay attention to detail.

My favorite thing about this place is they have happy hour until 730pm! The patio is great and the service was prompt. The portions are humongous and the food was good too. The food wasn't amaaaazing but it was good. My boyfriend got a massive plate of nachos and I got a BLT with sweet potato fries. If you're looking for a good happy hour place to eat and have some drinks in this area, I'd recommend here.

Great ambience and service.  They make their own salad dressings, plus.  Slice of cucumber in the water, classy.  The Daily Dose burger was perfectly cooked - the fries mediocre but the rest made up for it.  With all the breakfast reviews can't wait to come back to try something (before 4 pm)
Food is so so. Probably not coming back since I just paid 10 dollars for two glasses of orange juice. Ridiculous. This isn't brunch at the Wrigley mansion.

Daily Dose used to be open for dinner,  but now they are a breakfast and lunch only type of place. They have great options for breakfast and brunch, and great burgers and salads  if you are interested in lunch fare. The servers are always nice and the atmosphere is casual. They have a nice patio to sit on and interior seating. Parking is always easy as well.

We have been going here every weekend for the last 6 years where the bar is open seating. Last month, the hotess said you have to be on the waiting list even for the bar. Last weekend, that wasn't the case. And now, the rule is back on. We like the food but it's not worth the yo-yo policy. Pick a policy and stick with it. In our opinion, the bar area should be first come first serve.

Just what the neighborhood needed: A family restaurant open long hours with a real bar and a nice patio.  Breakfast menu features a nice selection of omeletes and pancakes among other things. It's served until 4PM. The coffee is very good.   It's not cheap, but you tend to get what you pay for.  No real downside perceived here. I'll be back.

I only gave this daily does 4 stars because although I still absolutely LOVED my meal and continue to dream about it daily, I did not LOVE this location as much at the Old Town location. I found that the Old Town location puts much more love and care into their work from the plating to the serving.   Now for the food, this is my #1 breakfast restaurant ever hands down!!!!!!!   GET THE Breakfast Tostada Benedict... It will change your life!! I dream about this meal daily!  Honorable mention to the filet Benedict and also the steak bowl!! Either way everyhing is amazing and delicious!  If you are in Phoenix this is THE PLACE to get breakfast! And is totally worth going out of your way like I made my fiance do for me!  But the old town is the best location for sure!!!

Delicious breakfast, consistently great service & wait is never too long (earlier the better on the weekend). We go here at least twice a month even though we live further away than we used to. Have tried many other breakfast places in the area, but return to DD when we really just want a great breakfast we can count on.

Daily Dose midtown is a huge disappointment, gave this place a second chance and it is our last. Service couldn't be worse. Most of the staff doesn't seem to care about it's customers or the place itself. This place seemed night and day compared to the Old Town location. Better pick it up or Snooze will hurt their biz for sure.

My husband and I stopped in for Easter morning brunch. We were seated with no wait, but sat for a good 10 minutes before addressed.  When the waitress approached, we were ready to order coffee and breakfast. We both had regular coffee, served piping hot in giant mugs. I also ordered a sugar free white chocolate syrup, which was tasty.  For breakfast my husband had the hangover sandwich. He loved it, and the potatoes that accompanied his sandwich. I had the straight shooter with 2 eggs, meat, fruit and 2 pancakes. I had turkey sausage which was delicious. The star was definitely the pancakes. I had protein pancakes with blueberries. I paid the extra buck for real maple syrup (totally worth it) but the pancakes had such great flavor and texture they didn't require syrup. All in all, a wonderful meal that will tide us over until dinner. Our orders were correct and food was delicious! We will be back.

Great place for any time of the day. I've had breakfast, lunch, and dinner here. The food is consistently good, staff is always friendly, and the restaurant is clean and very nice. It's a bit pricey-er than other places in the area, but you get what you pay for.  Highly recommend this restaurant.
Huge menu and big portions at a reasonable price. Decent kid's menu, too. This place was great and we will return.   P.S. try the chicken nachos!

I went to this place twice in two days.  The first day I sat at a table and was served quickly and the food was hot, right off the griddle  The server was very attentive and conversational.  The next day I sat at the counter and the server behind the bar (hard to label her a "bartender" at 8:00 AM) was very engaging and friendly.  Again, the food was served quickly and was right off the griddle and the coffee was fresh and hot.    The menu is unique with several great options.  If you're in the area and haven't tried this place, find it.  This place is definitely worth finding.

Great place to eat breakfast. My personal favorite is the breakfasts nachos. The waitress even informed me it was ranked in the nation. Which was interesting. They have some great selections for coffee as well as bar. I would recommend this place to anyone in Phoenix looking to get some good grub!

Great ambiance and location. The wait staff is friendly and accommodating. The food was a bit pricey for the quality. I ordered the Poblano Benedict or something like that.  It was   generally lacking on flavor.  The breakfast potatoes were over spiced and over cooked.  The turkey sausage was not seasoned and rather bland.  Coffee was great. I'd cautiously try again.

Love this location! If snooze is busy, just come here! Just come here anyway!! They always seem to have space! Awesome servers, love Sass! Turkey Sausage Polenta bowl is to die for! Great bloody marys, dog friendly patio! Love this place!!
Waffles and the delish hash are the things to eat. Go early for breakfast to beat the crowd.

A regular spot for family dinner, love the service and the Mac and Cheese is incredible! Great atmosphere and the menu has a bit of something for everyone. I highly recommend the cinnamon roll with ice cream, oh and the cilantro lime salad dressing (on a salad, not the cinnamon roll) is amazing!

Went to the old town location a couple weeks ago and was impressed. Today we went to the other location. Food was still good. But service was lacking. I think it was just because they were super busy and didn't have as many staff working as the other location. So our server was also the bartender.  We waited maybe 20 mins. Wasn't too bad. We split the breakfast nachos. Which is amazing by the way. We probably should have just had that. But husband had some pancakes and I had eggs Benedict with turkey sausage.  Nachos were my fav. Melted cheese and gooey cheese. Chorizo scrambled eggs. Pico and sausage gravy. Yum

Costumer service was slow. Took 15 minutes to get our waitress and 15 minutes for our drinks to come.  South west wrap, my sister like her wrap, but needs a hint of spice, she said.  Banana bread french toast, grandma said it was so sweet. The sauce was drenched when she got it. Definitely no need syrup for these bad boys. She liked her bowl of fruit better.  Veggie Omlette with potatoes. VEGGIE, yeah. No veggies. More of cheese and egg whites. didn't finish it. It was too bland, but tapitio and ketchup made it better.  Haha.. my potato was over cooked and had so much season on it. My whole wheat bread tasted old and stale. Im over all disappointed.. shrugs..

Unfortunately Daily Dose has decided to start using cheaper ingredients and has really gone downhill.  They changed their house made turkey sausage for the worse (tastes overcooked, old, frozen) the last 3 times I have been in, so it has not been a 1 time thing.  Last few times have been disappointing, which is a shame as this was once a great breakfast place.  With so many other good options close by, I do not believe we will be making another return visit

This is the best brunch I've ever had. The service was incredible (long wait, but I can see why), the drinks were great (who doesn't love a good mimosa) and the food was heavenly. I enjoyed the eggs benedict and it was hands down the best I've eaten. Will be returning here for brunch again.
Great place for the price, food is above good. But a fun place for chillin with friends...
Always great food!! I luv that they have happy hour 7 days a week. This is one of my favorites.

A friend of mine wanted to meet here for brunch. I had never even heard of this place and wasn't sure what to expect. It was extremely busy, we weren't able to get a table on the patio and were seated toward the back of the restaurant. Waitress was friendly and quick. However, I was not impressed with their food. It was way overpriced for what we were served. I doubt I'll be back.

Great disappointment :( We heard this place was great, but experienced nothing great. The Chorizo mac and cheese was mediocre at best. The Shrimp quesadilla was horrible. To add salt to wound, the table we sat at had ANTS. My 6 year old killed them as we waited for the phone. We notified the waitress and the manager. You'd think they would have comp'ed at least an appetizer. Nope. Nothing for the inconvenience of having unwelcome visitors at the table.

About as pleasantly memorable as a fart in an Elevator this eatery is shining tribute to mediocrity in absolutely every possible vantage point.    The brunch crowd is able to enjoy commentary coffee while waiting and Ostensibly cold ice tea--upon closer inspection the ice tea has a small label "cucumber water" and after tasting the water one is instantly certain two things : 1) disappointment and 2) the complete absence of anything remotely cucumber involved in the garden hose quality H20 labeled in , again I giant ice tea container.   This trite experience is emblematic of everything wrong with this place -- why over promise and under deliver ?   The chorizo Mac n cheese was reminiscent of hamburger helper and ass (donkey meat); I wanted so badly for the chicken nachos to live up to their picture and description but Managed to fall short.  The salmon eggs Benedict was uninspiring And came with two orders of mediocre potatoes.    Our waiter was adequate but acted put upon when we asked to move out of the sun and was completely unapologetic after mistakingly bringing us a large orange juice.    This place makes promises o plenty but is a Denny's in disguise.  I hope our experience is not repeated.

I finally returned to daily dose because a friend wanted to try them out, and, I must say, they were better this time. I had the breakfast burger, which was actually pretty legit.... It was covered in some kind of magical cheese sauce that made it oh so tasty. I had their hash as my side..... Didn't love it so much. The husband had the biscuits and gravy and didn't care for that either. I think the food here may be very hot and miss, with some items being really great and others falling flat, which is rough when their price point isn't so cheap. Regardless, I was glad we gave them another try.

OK. It's just O-K. That's the best and only way I know how to describe daily dose. After several attempts to enjoy their food, they continue fall short. I got the Benedict and the hollandaise was thin, runny and tasteless. My son had a breakfast burger and it literally had no flavor and was a huge mess. I only really find myself here when every other breakfast spot is over packed.

This place always has great breakfast. I have them 4 stars because of the wait time. It's not their fault that they're popular and in demand. Just can't wait more than 20 mins to be seated and they don't take reservations.

This is our "go to" spot for breakfasts.  The staff is family when you become a known entity to them.  Love them all equally and do not plan on looking in the new restaurants of Phoenix for a solid first meal of the day.  Service, drinks, food, and management are all stellar and a well oiled machine.
Cute place. Service was good, food was very good, and prices are not out of control.  Gourmet burger on a prezel bun with side for about 10 or 11 bucks, not bad.  I'd be back.

TL;DR: Rude customer service who acts friendly to you and then talks garbage behind your back when they do not know you are standing right behind them. Cannot process simple breakfast orders without correcting it multiple times and has no concern for their customers, most importantly, does not know how to handle food or food temperature correctly which is dangerous! The manager Emily who when I asked to contact the owner and if they had yelp, twitter etc, said have fun on your yelp endeavors. Thanks Emily, hope you enjoy it more than we enjoyed your sub par food and rude service.    ***   So where do I even begin with this one? First of all, we discovered this on Amazon prime now app to order and I was like, sweet, a place that delivers breakfast! Great when you are sick and in pain, a nice simple breakfast delivered helps to start the day out better, at least it should. So I ordered a few times from here for me and the hubby and usually it was ok, nothing spectacular, but it's breakfast, can't mess it up too bad? Well I was wrong there.   First the quality started going down, so I called it in personally instead of going  through the amazon app and had the hubby pick it up, spoke to a gentleman named Keegan I believe, and he assured me the order would be done right this time, awesome!   My hubby brings the order home and well it was the worse one we have had yet and I do not know how that was possible considering the guy said he personally checked   everything. I ordered a salmon bagel, should be cold, RAW salmon, cream cheese and some toppings for the bagel. This was put into a food bag with steaming hot food, so cold raw salmon becomes warm bacteria breeding ground, yum! I do not wish to get sick because they do not know how to properly handle raw fish. This is dangerous for regular people, however, having a weakened immune system to begin with, I would have a bad time. I called him back and explained everything, there was a few other issues, basic things that were overlooked and messed up, but it will be a novel if I go into that. So he said "oh no we have a new guy back there and I should have checked better, etc", come back and I will remake it perfectly this time! As it was a 20 minute drive each way, I said my husband will come back tomorrow instead. He said speak to the Manager named Emily and she will make it right for you guys.   I called Emily today, she sounded nice and apologetic over the phone and took the   order and said come in 15 minutes, great. My hubby was close to the area so he end up getting in a bit earlier and hears the manager with her back turned to him screaming to the back "Make sure to bag everything separately, keep the hot food away from the cold food oh and attach an extra arm" ( If you missed that, she was basically saying we are asking for the impossible and being so whiny that the chef should literally detach his own arm and include it ) So the chef proceeds to laugh, a few servers and herself. Then she turns around and my husband says " We dont need the arm, thanks", to which she changes her tune into oh tee hee, I did not mean it like that! Unsure how else she could have meant that, what I think she meant was, she did not mean for us to overhear her, but then again, she was yelling loud enough so that anyone in that general vicinity could hear. Her managerial skills were on point. When I called her about it, she seemed to not really care about what I had to say, was extremely flippant about the whole situation and just acted like a spoiled brat, rather than a restaurant manager.   I do not mind dealing with shitty customer service as people always have bad days, but being so rude that you do not bother to apologize for your stuck up behavior, and that you cannot get basic orders correct and make sure that food quality is up to par with your price, something needs to be fixed. 12.50$ for a bagel and cream cheese with about 1oz of warm salmon is not going to make up for your attitudes. If that is how they handle dealing with food issues, I do not even want to know what the quality is like in the kitchen and what on earth is being served to people as they do not have any basic understanding of food handling.
Great coffee flavor choices (maple latte) and a full bar with breakfast makes this place a brunch must.  Service is always great and the wait is never that long.  Inside or outside patio is great.
Most delicious pancakes I have ever had - full of fruit, fluffy, crunchy, healthy, yummy! Delightful waitress.
This is my first review on yelp.  I got the DD Bacon Bloody Mary with the Creole mix.  Wow.  Best Bloody Mary I ever had. Will come back just for that.  The food was great too.

This place is not that great. The line at all the other brunch areas nearby were long wait times on a Sunday afternoon so I came here because they're was no wait time. I should have taken that as a sign to leave. The food I ordered was terrible and did not taste good at all. There was absolutely no flavor and our waitress was giving us a lot of attitude like she didn't want to be there. I was very disappointed with this experience as I did not have high expectations but the standard definitely want meet and feel way below what I was paying for. My portion of the meal came to $35 so I wasn't spending chip change, so understand a little on why I was frustrated with the experience. I'd say if you hate waiting and want food quick, this place can fill that void, even though the food may not be good.

My wife and I went here expecting much better. I had prime rib benedict and it was flavorless. My coke was flat and didn't change after 3 times of sending it back. My wife had the roasted red pepper benedict and said it was bland and wasn't impressed at all. The service however was very good.

I met my daughter here for late breakfast and it was our first time here. We were greeted and seated immediately, the restaurant was clean and we placed our order within 10 minutes. The food took approximately 20 minutes to arrive,not too bad. I had the chile Verde huevos ranchers, it was very dried out pork with very little chile verde. I didn't see any cilantro or sour cream with the dish. My daughter had the breakfast burger and she said it was bland. I wouldn't recommend this place for breakfast as there are a lot of other great breakfast places close by.

Thank you so much for the gracious service. We were in the midst of a family emergency and our server respectfully waited it all out - again thanks so much!! I love the food here and my pretzel bread french toast was one of the best breakfasts I've ever had anywhere. So good. But... my friend's fried chicken and waffle - the waffle looked fluffy but was dry and doughy. The huevos rancheros - interesting and good, but not great. I'll manage a 4-star review because I absolutely love the place, but some work is needed to get to a 5-star rating.

Love this place. They have so many options on their menu it's hard to choose so I have to keep coming back to try new things. The last time I got the lox which was amazing. It comes with fruit and a small salad. I've had the pancakes and nachos too and they all meet expectations. Only thing I didn't like is the turkey sausage. It doesn't seem to have much taste. Kind of bland and over priced so I would get that again. Everything else including the atmosphere, outdoor seating, and service service was perfect. Definitely recommend and will go at least once or twice a month for brunch.

We came here for brunch with my daughter and son in law.  Nice to see the area developing again.  The place has a lot of room and is decorated nicely.  The coffee was good and hot, mimosa is a bud vase (?). I had the grain pancakes and OMG are those some dense flapjacks but they were quite tasty.  The food the hubby and others had looked good as well.  The place was jumping for sure but the staff was very courteous and professional.

I ordered medium rare salmon and received a rubbery overdone inedible glob of something else instead.  Later, I was surprised to note that my bill included charges for the horrible entree, although after a single bite, I brought the matter to the waitress' attention and she removed the full plate of food from our table ... To politely dispute the bill, I kindly reminded the waitress of the earlier exchange and she said that she would remove the cost of the entree from my bill.  Rather than follow thru on her promise, the waitress wrote me a note saying that she had discounted the entree by half rather than 100%!  So, what just happened there and why should the customer pay for the restaurant's error?  The booth and ladies' room lacked cleanliness as well...Needless to say, we will not return.

Daily Dose has quickly become one of my favorite brunch places. The place is always slammed, but I'm usually alone so I can typically score a spot at the bar pretty quickly. I've also eaten on the patio as well as in the back part of the restaurant.   The menu has breakfast and lunch -- omelets, sandwiches, salads, etc. I love the bacon omelet. That dish is more than enough to fill you up. It comes with a side (I usually get fruit), bread (I usually get an English muffin), and choice of potato-type starch. The omelet itself has peppered bacon, mozzarella cheese and tomatoes, and is topped with about a quarter of an avocado -- YUM!! I usually get cranberry juice and coffee to wash it down.   On Sundays you can catch several football games on the TVs at the bar. The bartenders have always provided great service.
Great breakfast joint! The staff was awesome...almost too nice!  Breakfast nachos are insane!!!!!!  Have been a few times and haven't been disappointed once.  Definitely worth a try.

Been wanting to try this place for awhile now, so finally did this morning. Must say first impressions are everything for a business including how their employees conduct themselves while providing customer service. Ambiance was great and inviting when we walked through the front entrance. There was not host or hostess attending the front door, but a customer who we saw walked in as we pulled in the parking lot. He was standing there patiently waiting with no acknowledgement from the moment he walked in, as we began to experience the same lack of service. I then walked back to the bar to get some service for seating for this gentlemen and our party as well only to be confronted by the rudest person in the establishment. She was rude all the way to sitting us and made it known to her fellow employees, my wife wanted to walk out and go somewhere else, but I decide to stay and ride it out and give them a chance. She made a lot of excuses and was rude even further when we requested a booth over a high top, this employee has a lack of situational awareness and forgot that this is solely a customer service driven industry. Businesses such as this on relies heavily on reviews and word of mouth such as this. She became a liability and not an asset to this business this morning, who obviously made the investment in her employment.  So part two of this review, our server was friendly and the food was delicious but a little on the cooler side. The food probably sat in the back for awhile before it came out at that temperature, which is usually the case for cooler food. So I am torn about this restaurant, which is too bad because the food tasty. I think that the management here is due for a staff meeting to tighten up the ship. The place was only half way to capacity to not have any of these device issues this morning.  There are plenty of great restaurants in this Central Phoenix area that truly nail it every time. Unfortunately this was not that day for The Daily
